Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and friendly staff here”
Reviews.Author: Lynne K
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 notes here on our first trip to Italy. After arriving jet lagged at 10:00 AM we left our luggage there and came back after lunch and were allowed up earlier when the nicest desk clerk took pity on me! Cleanest bathroom I ever saw! It looked brand new! Very high tech and unique too. Comfortable bed, great breakfast layout, very helpful and friendly front desk who confirmed a tour booking for us with a big smile and asked upon our return how it was! Great central location and wonderful restaurants and shops nearby too. Would have liked having an English tv channel though such as BBC to catch the weather and news back in the states. I think there was one on Sky? tv but think you had to pay extra for it, but we got along fine without it anyway, very busy sightseeing. Would definitely recommend and return when back in Rome someday...

Reviews.Title: “Just What We Needed!”
Reviews.Author: garylim007
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Rome. We stayed in Hotel Sonya for 3 nights. It is a great choice. As we needed somewhere near the Termini Station at an affordable price, this hotel provided just what we needed. The room was clean and spacious. Their breakfast was enjoyable with lots to choose from. Service was good; they even gave us a welcome wine on our first day. It is located near the metro; only 5 min walk. The neighborhood is city-like; that is probably the only reason we may choose another hotel next time. We would prefer to be somewhere near the Pantheon area. There is a lovely restaurant very near the hotel (Antica Boheme). The food was really good and we enjoyed our dinners there so much; highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Lynn W
Reviews.Content: We only had one night to spend in Rome and chose the Hotel Sonya from a Rick Steve's book. It is a great choice. Though the rooms are small, they are clean and very high tech. We even had the ability to make tea and coffee right in the room. It was very clean. We had a great breakfast included and the staff was helpful and friendly. We found the location perfect in that we could walk to many things.

Reviews.Title: “Good, central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Onvacation_2012
Reviews.Content: Really liked this hotel in Rome. It was very clean and the rooms were wonderful. The breakfast each morning was basic, but pleasant and the coffee wonderful. The staff was very friendly and available to answer questions. This hotel is close to the main station and many restaurants and shops. We walked to the double decker busses and took them to all the main tourist attractions . This hotel was a great choice for us and we were definitely not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what they advertise, clean, friendly and great location.”
Reviews.Author: avocadomovado
Reviews.Content: I loved Rome! I went back and forth before our trip on this hotel but I'm glad I chose it. It was super clean, well run, great location and I loved the old style building! The windows opened into a courtyard where we could look into and out at other apartments and get a feel of how life really is in Rome! I totally enjoyed listening to someone playing thier piano and the birds chirping. This was the only hotel on our Europe vacation that we said yes to the breakfast and it was delightful. It was a great mix of healthy and local along with custom cups of coffee. The staff were helpful and really friendly. It was a real pleasure. It was simple but clean and well run.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Frisco02
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and thought the hotel, the staff and the location were excellent, from the time we arrived at the hotel (to drop our bags off as we arrived early in the day) until the moment we left the Staff made us feel welcome, We had a room on the 1st floor and again we could not fault it. The breakfast was also very good. You are not far from the train station although we walked everywhere so we could get the feel for Rome, it took us about 45 minutes to walk from the hotel to the Vatican and about 15 minutes to the Coliseum. All in all we would recommend this hotel and when we return to Rome we shall be looking to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable place for our family of 5”
Reviews.Author: Uluave
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March 2012, two adults and three kids (17, 14, and 10). The location was a comfortable walk from the train station. The front desk was helpful. Breakfast was excellent. The room was small but comfortable (we had 2 double beds and a twin bed) and the shower was clean with excellent water pressure. We walked to see the Colosseum etc. one day and took an easy subway ride to the Vatican the next day. We wandered the neighborhood freely, both day and night, and felt safe and comfortable. This was not a luxury hotel, but it was a great mid-range place that served our needs well.

Reviews.Title: “it was so nice”
Reviews.Author: ili2012
Reviews.Content: we spent a week in this hotel ,very well located ,close to the central station ,opposite to opera,very nice hotel, good staff ,clean ,not so bibut nice rooms, good beds, clean ,big bathroom,and good service. breakfast was buffet, nice. i can recommend this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cruisersister
Reviews.Content: From the minute we arrived to the day we checked out we were treated like old friends. The staff for breakfast we all fell in love with them. We Grandma's (4) were treated as if we were their very own. Breakfast was served until 10am and it was excellent. Pastries and all the other items were beyond our expectations. We had a problem with our converter and borrowed one for a day; then one of the guys went with us to translate and helped us find one that would work in the usa as well as in all of europe. We will be back next year in April and can not wait to see everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: RubyCoco
Reviews.Content: Just back from a wonderful stay in Italy including 4 nights in Hotel Sonya in Rome. Less than 5 minutes walk from the Termini Station, and only 10 / 15 minutes stroll to most sights this is a great hotel for location and comfort. The rooms are obviously newly decorated, very modern for italian standards, comfy double bed, brilliant bathroom with shower, lots of storage, safe, minibar, and spotlessly clean. The staff are so friendly and helpful, and the breakfast is a wonderful start to the day with plenty to choose from. If you were like us looking for a hotel on the net and with so many to choose from, stay here you will not be disappointed its a great place. The website photos are up to date, the rooms are as the pictures.

Reviews.Title: “Does what is says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: Dominic37
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the Six Nations rugby weekend of February 12th 2012. The staff were very helpful and extremely polite. Our room had been recently refurbished and was lovely. A good choice for breakfast. The location was excellent. We would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: RenoRuss
Reviews.Content: We spent 12 nights here, prior to boarding a transatlantic cruise. We were a bit anxious due to some of the reviews we read. It's hard to imagine the reviewers stayed at the same hotel. The staff could not have been friendlier nor more accommodating. Rana, the night desk clerk, greeted us warmly upon arrival and reminded us he was behind the e-mails we exchanged during the reservation process. Ivan, the day desk manager, went to great lengths to help us get our Papal Audience appointment (requires an outgoing and return fax), and took care of a fax we needed to send to the States, all at no charge! The room was comfortable (and normal sized for Europe, small by US standards), and the comfortable and spacious bathroom was recently refurbished in modern European style. The breakfast was superb with great service from the wait staff. Unlimited cappuccinos are included! The complimentary WiFi service worked well, although it was annoying to have to get a new sign-on from the front desk every six hours. Ask for a 24 hour sign-on; one clerk was able to do that for us. This was an honest three star hotel in a great location (across the street from the opera house). It is not luxurious, but it's comfortable and a great value. We will definitely stay here again when next in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, room, & location.”
Reviews.Author: binniesweets
Reviews.Content: We stayed end of January and again in February. What a great hotel. The breakfast was exceptional. You save at least 15 euro a day by eating at the hotel. The distance to the Metro is close and the termini is close as well. If the weather is good just walk to the hotel and save some money. Rooms were nice and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: Gareth B
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Sonya is really excellent. The room was of a good size and clean. The bed comfortable and the shower great. The staff were very helpful. Breakfast was excellent. Only a 10 minute walk from Termini station and the metro. We will be staying here next time we're in Rome. Overall an excellent hotel for an amazing price. Only negative was the lack of a full length mirror in the room - not a major issue but would have been nice. As this is the only negative it shows how great the hotel is!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: mrktwise
Reviews.Content: I had a single room overlooking the plaza and Opera House for my three days in Rome. The location was very good since I had arrived via the nearby train station. It is also quite easy to get to the main attractions from the hotel and I found the staff very helpful. It is worth mentioning that the same group operates the Sonya Suites nearby and due to a mix-up I spent my first night there. I must admit that the Suites are a step-up from the Sonya but I was pleased with my accomodations during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jaybee50
Reviews.Content: A group of 10 of us stayed here for 5 nights in February, spread over 4 rooms on the 5th floor. The rooms have apparently been recently renovated and everyone in the group agreed they were of a good standard for the money, very clean and tidy, if a little tight for space in the triple rooms. The staff at the hotel are friendly and helpful, securing us a restaurant booking for Valentine's night. The breakfast is average - the biggest gripe being that when being offered "juice" we were served cordial. But I can honestly say that without exception everyone in our group felt the hotel's location and rooms made it excellent value for money, with the staff adding to the value. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, newly renovated room!”
Reviews.Author: morian13
Reviews.Content: We had read reviews on TripAdvisor to avoid the annex, so we did. We stayed on the 5th floor and the room was gorgeous. It was newly renovated, and HUGE. It had a beautiful bathroom, heated towel rack and huge shower. The front desk service was great. They served a very good breakfast. The room was a little crowded but we were able to find a table each morning. The hotel is in great location in Rome, close to Termini (less than 10 minute walk). We paid cash and received a 8% discount because of this. Make sure to ask about this or the Rick Steve's discount. We would DEFINITELY stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “hotel sonya”
Reviews.Author: Mariya S
Reviews.Content: its very good situated, pleasant servise, free wi fi

Reviews.Title: “Honest hotel”
Reviews.Author: angelspy
Reviews.Content: Honest hotel. Value for money. Good sized rooms. Clean, warm and comfortable. Free strong wi-fi in the rooms. The staff were polite and helpful, ready to solve every issue. Walking distance to all main atractions. Just 2 minutes walk from metro stations (Republica and Termini) and bus stop (40 and 64 to all major sights). The breakfast was ok. Don't be disappointed from the entrance and the reception. The rooms are on 3rd and 4th floor and are renovated. Recommended for anyone traveling on budget .

Reviews.Title: “Ivan makes it all worthwhile!”
Reviews.Author: jumpsturdy
Reviews.Content: Would like to thank Ivan at the front desk for all his help during my stay, which was unfortunately curtailed due to mechanical problems beyond night staff's control. I did feel that the people, especially Ivan, were courteous, friendly and helpful, showering me with guidebooks and capuccino. The location is not bad, especially during January sales, .... and it only takes a day or two to get one's bearings and learn the layout of Roma. Fontana di Trevi, Plaza Espagna and Campo de Fiori are all fairly close. Great rates too, I should add. Grazie, Ivan for your grand good cheer which improved my trip in so many ways!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, central location”
Reviews.Author: Julavies
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights and the staff were polite and friendly from the moment we arrived to the moment we left. The use of a laptop in our room to check Internet was a nice touch and the helpful local information from the reception desk was appreciated. The room was clean and although not a breathtaking view, the enclosed courtyard meant that it maintained an unexpected quietness in the centre of the capital city. The room itself was clean and the bed wonderfully comfortable and big. The shower was strong and hot. We enjoyed our stay and would recommend anyone to go for a break at Hotel Sonya. Thank you for making our time in Rome so special.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: BlueSky411
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel over Christmas for 8 days. The location is nice, not a tourist trap. We stayed in room 335 (very nice room, large with nice window....the only sore point is the cleaning ladies' locker is right next to it so it gets noisy with their preparation and chatter from 7:40am to 8am)....not good if you want to sleep till late (like my DW). We enjoyed the bar across from the hotel, took advantage of the location to ply around Rome in a bus or Metro and ice cream most evenings. One of the highlights of the stay was the dinner we had at restaurant Holiday - 1 block from the hotel. Babul, Sanjoy are most helpful. The hotel served us a spread at breakfast that was one of the best we had in Italy - a couple of hot dish choices, fruit, yogurt, cereal and some very good capuccino. We had great fun walking in Rome, shopping and then ending our days in restaurants around the hotel. We also took bus/metro rides to try out restaurants distant from the hotel. Given the location coming back late evening was easy and not a challenge. We aim to be back and be able to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Want the best hotel to walk around Rome from this is the place..... Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Kilimanjaro1967
Reviews.Content: A great welcome and shown to our recently refurbished room. Instantly happy. Spotless, modern, all normal modcons. Asked for a restaurant and directed to a Pizzeria on boxing day.... Wow never went anywhere else turn left out of hotel take your 2 right and first pizza place on right..... Enjoy.....great hotel and staff would go back tomorrow. Thank you Hotel Sonya.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Corvolho
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just great. It is within a walk distance from the Termini Station, where you can take the shuttle to the airport or train to your next destination. The building was sort of old, but when we opened the door to the rooms: SURPRISE. It is renewed! Beautiful room, with LCD television, safe and for Europe it is a good size. The breakfast is very good and kind of funny. The lady who probably owns the business scream a lot with the employees! They seem to don't care and make of this a funny situation. Typical Italian!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Domercruisers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Sonya from Nov 22-29, 2011. We are writing to commend the wonderful staff at this hotel. From the moment we checked in and until our departure, every staff member treated us well. At our early check in, Ivan graciously offered us to have some breakfast and told us our room would be ready in about one hour. This was greatly appreciated, since we had been flying all night. Joy escorted us to our room and assisted us with our luggage. Our room, 540, was comfortable and exceptionally clean. The daily maid service was excellent. Babu and Ivan both assisted us in obtaining reservations for the Borghese museum, and directed us to local restaurants which were exceptional in cuisine and value for money. The breakfast served was more than ample, and Joy made sure we had juice and cappuccino each morning. We even had the pleasure of meeting Ms. Sonya, and Babu translated our enjoyment of her hotel. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone, and definitely plan to stay there again on our next trip to Rome. Thanks again for a wonderful stay in your fabulous city.

Reviews.Title: “Been a while, but had to leave a review”
Reviews.Author: bsearched
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days before a cruise. It was perfect. We walked everywhere. Little far from the Vatican, but still walking distance for an active family. The hotel was beautiful, breakfast was awesome, and the staff was great. If we visit Rome again, we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best place, best price”
Reviews.Author: gin5123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Sonya on our second trip to Rome for a few days precruise. We loved the Opera Theater area, as it is so close to all transportation and surrounding shops and restaurants are very reasonable. Our room was lovely and updated with nice bath. The breakfast was very nice, and the staff was always pleasant and helpful. Free wifi as well. So much better than staying in the crowded, over touristy hotels near Vatican City or Trevi Fountain, Coliseum, etc. You just can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place”
Reviews.Author: Anne H
Reviews.Content: We spent our last night in Rome here and wished our other Rome accommodation was as nice as this. We stayed on the newly renovated 5th floor and it was great. Nicely furnished, comfortable beds, clean bathrooms. Staff was so nice and the WiFi worked great. This hotel is on the Coliseum side of Rome and close to the train station. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: AppyTravels
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sonya was in a fabulous location and it was really easy to find. The room was spacious and clean. The bed was comfortable, just what we needed for rest after a big day of sight seeing. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Breakfast was a delightful, with a selection of cakes, fruit and bread. Overall, we had a great stay at Hotel Sonya and could not fault them in any aspect. We will stay again if we return to Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely nice,we really enjoyed it.”
Reviews.Author: Ekaterina S
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in hotel. Everything was wonderful, very friendly atmosphere, the receptionists gave us some helpful information.I had asked for a room with a nice view, and I got it.The room was cosy and modern equipped,including a kettle, a tea set and a hair dryer. We were especially fond of the interiors, very stylish with their Christmas decorations. The breakfast was good,we got eggs,ham ,yogurt,different kinds of cakes and cereal. I would rather have some cheese and olives instead of cakes...But nothing is perfect in our World... Very friendly waiters offered tea or coffee. We liked tender and sweet oranges and pears. There are two computers with free Internet in the lobby. it was a little noisy at night as we opened the window. But we could hear the bells ringing and the doves..So it was more romantic than annoying. The location is also excellent, 7 minutes of Termini station, 15-20 minutes from Colosseo and Foro Romano. We did not use any public transportation. In general the hotel turned out to be much better than I expected for the reasonable price. It is the best *** hotel I have ever seen. I would return there without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sonya in Rome”
Reviews.Author: slim38
Reviews.Content: Our stay was very nice. The room was adequate and the hotel is in a great location for walking to sites. The hotel staff was fery friendly and willing to help with direction to specific places. A very nice breakfast was included in the price. I would definitely return to this on a future trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel within walking distance of the main station”
Reviews.Author: andychem18
Reviews.Content: A great hotel within 5 minutes of the main railway/ bus station so easy to get to and from with cases. The rooms are large with a full sized show in the bathroom. The breakfast was standard Italian fare with pastries, cooked meats, cereals, fruit and yogurts, so if you could always find something to eat. If you needed any thing else then there is a supermarket opposite the hotel to stock up with everything else. When it comes to getting to the sites you are close to the train and bus station so it is easy to use public transport. If you feel like walking you can be at the Forum or the Coliseum in about 10 minutes (down hill).

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sonya Met our Needs”
Reviews.Author: gilladj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Sonya for 5 nights in November 2011 before boarding a cruise ship. We walked (dragging one suitcase) from the train station without difficulty. I had used Google maps to get the lay of the land. We were given a small room on a higher floor. The bell man brought our bags up showed us the room and left so quickly I was not able to tip. I did tip him later. The room was small as mentioned but clean. The bathroom was modern and we did get one of the small shower rooms. I am 6'1" and 250 pound sso I did bump my elbows a few time inside the shower. For us the location was great. Close enough to public transport but out of the busyness. The hotel desk staff helped us book soccer tickets and helped us navigate out to the stadium. This was a hoot of an experience. The breakfast was fine. It did get monotonous after five days of the same things but it filled us up for a day on our feet. We did not use the Wifi so can't speak to hwo well that works. For the price it was a great find in a good location. Would we stay here again? Yes!

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: RBJ354
Reviews.Content: If you can, opt for the 5th floor rooms- recently renovated and well in excess of 3 star rating. Breakfast ok and staff helpful. Location in excellent. 5 mins from Termini, towards a better part of town and 5 mins from Republica for metro etc. Good restuarants in the locale and also found a bar/cafe across the road to the side of the theatre that had a happy hour 4-8pm that made evening drinks affordable. Overall a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: kalitaxidi
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 4 nights at Hotel Sonya. Great breakfast and very helpful staff. Was able to get directions and advice when I needed it. Rooms are basic but clean and the beds are comfortable. The location was perfect for seeing Rome because of the close proximity to the Termini. With the Roma pass in hand we were able to travel all over Rome quickly and efficiently and find our way back home to the hotel. Most lines end up at the termini Don't miss the historic churches within walking distance (must see) and reasonable and good restaurant across the street. Free wifi a bonus but need to get a new password every 6 hours ( annoying ). Limited electrical outlets so bring an extra plug in.

Reviews.Title: “Just stay here”
Reviews.Author: Peter Y
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at Hotel Sonya in Oct 2011. Like others have said the location is great. What you can’t walk to you can get to on the metro that is a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Our room was very clean & comfortable. Elevator was pretty cool too. Best of all was the staff that was always courteous & helpful no matter how many times I asked for directions, restaurant suggestions or the internet password I lost repeatedly. Special thanks to Silvia who helped me arrange to have flowers for my wife in our room upon arrival and provided a bottle of wine as well for us to celebrate our 25th anniversary. It is nice to stay at a place where the people working there really get customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient to all parts of Rome”
Reviews.Author: korbt
Reviews.Content: Our room was a decent size, especially for Rome. The breakfast was very good and there was full access to the internet with three computers in the lobby. The hotel is close to the train station and within two blocks of the main drag, Via Nazionale, where we took the public bus to various location. We spent four nights at Hotel Sonya and we would recommend it for its location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Hotel Sonya”
Reviews.Author: swoodruf
Reviews.Content: I had a nice sized room overlooking a courtyard. The location was in walking distance of the Spanish Steps and lots of shopping. There is a grocery right across the street. Reception and staff were very helpful and pleasant. A wonderful breakfast buffet each morning started us off well each day. They had the BEST cappuccino! The servers in the morning were quick, cute, and very service oriented. They seemed to love their job.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be more pleased”
Reviews.Author: ckapkanoff
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed for a few nights before leaving on a cruise and we were very happy with the accomodations as well as the staff.The rooms were spotless and quite comfortable, the in room bathroom looked brand new. The pleasant staff speaks english and is never too busy to help. A real bargain in a generally overpriced city.The first day there, my daughter left her cel phone on the desk in the lobby,and we were half way across Rome when we realized it. I can't tell you how thankful we were to the fellow at the front desk who held it for us.I never got his name but would like to say Thanks Again!

Reviews.Title: “Very pricey compared to other 3 star hotels in area.”
Reviews.Author: Karen S
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and location. Breakfast wonderful. Booked using Rick Steve's rate of 150 euro but walk-ins were quoted 100 euro. Other 3 star hotels in area less than half. Be cautious of rate

Reviews.Title: “Good value, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Misstourguide
Reviews.Content: Rooms very nice and modern. What a surprise after entering the building with the antique elevator! People were very friendly. This building has several floors that are not part of the hotel. I loved the spacious shower, especially when you compare it with some other places we stayed (where you could hardly turn around).

Reviews.Title: “Modern clean room, conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: 11-jam
Reviews.Content: Great location within walking distance of Termini Station and the Metro. We stayed in the renovated section across the street. Rooms were small but clean, updated, and included a hairdryer and an electric pot to heat water for tea or coffee which was nice with the cooler evenings. Free wi-fi, a helpful staff, and a breakfast that included scrambled eggs and cappuccinos. Good restaurants and shopping nearby. This area of Rome was not nearly as overrun with tourists as the area near the Trevi Fountain. If you enjoy walking, you can walk to most of the major sites or take the Metro. We walked everywhere. Having stayed in a busier section of Rome previously, I would highly recommend this area and the Hotel Sonya, and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern rooms at a good price!”
Reviews.Author: CnB2011fl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Sonya for three nights. The room was clean and spacious. Free wi-fi was definitely a plus. The breakfast was tasty and included cappuccinos. The location was good, we walked everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: nairbwal60
Reviews.Content: A well sited hotel, close to Termini Station and tour buses. It represents value for money. I stayed there with my wife in November 2011 and was glad to have made this choice. The food was basic, but edible, perhaps they could expand their choices for breakfast. The staff friendly and the rooms were clean. There are a number of good restaurents in close proximity, however, beware of the Washington Snack Bar. I would recommend the Sonya , and if I return to Rome I would book-in there again. Brian , Northern Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ShirleyValentineSr
Reviews.Content: As a senior solo traveller I relied on TripAdvisor reviews to assist selecting hotels and this hotel was recommended. It is clean and centrally located with a good breakfast and free internet. The only two staff I could commend are the cleaning lady and the young lady assisting with breakfast. Rick Steves recommends this hotel with the caveat the service is impersonal and that is understated. Upon arrival I was shunted to their annex, which had not been previously agreed. I am used to single rooms not being the premium rooms but this room was dismal. No place for my luggage and the "window" looked onto an interior piping shaft for the building. It was covered with drapes to give a window effect but the room was without any natural light. The interior lighting was poor as there was no ceiling light, just one over the bed and lights on one wall. As a solo traveller assistance from hotel staff re: restaurants, tours, safety, etc. is important. The day of arrival I asked reception for a restaurant recommendation and was told "go right or left". Another tourist in the lobby gave me some advice. A request for brochures was met with a shrug. I went to the main hotel and was told he was part-time staff. There was some little improvement in reception staff but not much. In the morning I asked if the bedspread could be changed as it stunk of cigarette smoke. This request seemed to irritate the new (and as I had bveen told, better) man and indeed was not done until I spoke to the cleaning lady, who was extremely accommodating.The bathroom was clean and appeared to have been recently renovated. The walls were thin and movement and talking could be heard from adjacent rooms. The water pump malfunctioned one night and as it was right outside my "window" it kept me awake all night. I complained at 6 am when I thought there would be someone available to fix the noise. When I requested some form of compensation I was told I should have complained earlier and they would have moved me. Pardon my consideration. I was told I had already been put in a double room and when I pointed out the deficiencies it became a "one and a half" room. A half??? A half of what??? A request for a wake up call was ignored and I almost missed a pre-paid tour, luckily waking 15 min before pick-up. I do not recommend nor would I stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Down to my expectations”
Reviews.Author: dmdoc
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews and seen all the non-professional photos,booked Hotel Sonya for the weekend,but it finally didn't even reach my expectations.The room was on the third floor extremely small,not even having space to move around or facilitating our luggage.The furniture was old fashioned,the bathroom also small with a minute shower.There was a wall-to-wall rope for the used towels that weren't changed for the whole weekend.Maybe "cleaning the room" for them means spreading the sheets(not even changing them).In the room we didn't even have a waste basket,so we were obliged to see our litter in the same place every day.Breakfast was poor with no variety of food,which wasn't even warm and we had to make a request in order to refill the buffet. The main exception was the staff,that was very very helpfull and polite. Generally,Hotel Sonya was not a good experience,a bad choice for any traveller that is willing to pay more than 80euros per night for the double room. I wonder if the traveller's photos are from the same hotel!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A real gem”
Reviews.Author: Caxe08
Reviews.Content: Just back from a four day visit to Rome. We stayed at the Hotel Sonya. On first sight it doesn't impress you as a Hotel. It is more like those old Italian 'palazzi'. It even has an old lift which in my life I had never seen anything like it, but it worked well!!!! The receptionist was really nice and came up with us to the 4th floor to show us to our room. Behind a big old wooden door, there was a modern corridor with rooms in it, and ours was one of them. Once we walked in the room we were surprised because it was a very good-sized modern room with a big king bed. The bathroom was fantastic. Everywhere was spotless. On the morrow we went down for breakfast where we were served by the sweet boy from Bangladash in his smart uniform. He treated us like royalty and the breakfast was great with fresh bread, frresh salad, cheese, eggs, cereals, croissants, biscuits, cakes and fresh fruit. Hotel Sonya turned out to be a dream even in its location..only 750 metres from the Termini Station and the surroundings are beautiful. Finally last but not least I would like to mention IVAN..the day receptionist....he was always there to help us when we needed any information. Thanks Hotel Sonya, you are a gem !!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, Location”
Reviews.Author: sunlovers4ever
Reviews.Content: Upon driving into Rome, we found Hotel Sonya easily by using our GPS. Hotel staff were quick to greet us and help unload our suitcases. Once done there is a carpark just around the corner. Our suitcases along with the hotel porter went up first in the very old, looks like 1920 vintage elevator as it can only lift so many pounds. We went up next and found our room very spacius, clean and the bathroom looked like it had just been renovated. Once settled in, we found ourselves within easy walking distance to the Coliseum, about 15 minutes. The bed was comfortable for any bed in Italy. Breakfast consisted of pastries, cheezes, cold cuts, hot egg items, breads, juices and coffee. The area surrounding this hotel has many little shops which is nice if this is your first time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in downtown Rome”
Reviews.Author: RHA1936
Reviews.Content: A fine place to stay in downtown Rome, across the street from the opera house, close to metro stop and train terminal, walking distance to many Rome sites. Metro or bus advisable to go to the Vatican. Modest but adequate-size room, somewhat cramped bathroom. Breakfast with a lot of variety and staff offering juice, coffee, etc. Stayed for three nights in early October 2011 and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location near the train station”
Reviews.Author: Ballardgal50
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights before taking the train to Naples. Great location near the Metro and the train station. Room was nice and very clean. Breakfast was very good and yummy cappucino! I enjoyed the stay!

Reviews.Title: “my choice for Rome”
Reviews.Author: SueC1
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Hotel Sonya so obviously it works for us. We've traveled to Rome quite a few times over the years and on earlier trips I took the advice of others who did not like the Termini area but IMO that area is just fine and super convenient, either for Rome sightseeing, day trips or for when you need just a night before heading out. Hotel Sonya is easily walkable from Termini - no need to fool with a taxi (where we have been ripped off several times). On both our stays, we arrived off transatlantic flights and the staff was very helpful with getting us into a room. On our recent visit they kindly upgraded us to a suite in their "new" addition at the Hotel Opera (so I can't make any judgement on the regular rooms there). There are many pleasant restaurants nearby, a grocery store, other shops and public transportation is also convenient. Hopefully we will return to Rome next fall and we'll return to Hotel Sonya.

Reviews.Title: “It was clean, that's about it”
Reviews.Author: Tanya B
Reviews.Content: Stayed first 3 nights in L'Opera, room was small but adequate and clean, would definitely not have booked here if I had had accurate photos to view the rooms and reliable reviews. Last night of our trip we had also booked here, stayed in main hotel, room was SO small, the 2 of us and bellboy had to open door and walk in to room in single file then turn around to close door. No room for luggage on floor, barely walking room around bed. Budget accomodation is not reflected in room rates. Perhaps overhyped on the Rick Steves association?? I wouldn't stay at another of his recommended places.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny, Smelly Room -Don't Arrive Late!”
Reviews.Author: NW_Happy_Feet
Reviews.Content: When we checked in we were told we would be put in the "new" secion, which turned out to be the old Hotel L'Opera Roma about a half block away which the Sonya had acquired. We got a tiny room with a bad smell. Don't know what the smell was - not stale cigarette smoke. A sour stench that brought flashbacks of the boy's lock room in Jr. High School. I had a tape measure and checked the room dimensions: 11ft 3 in L x 7ft 8in. Wide at thenarrow end and 9ft 3in wide at the wider end (it wasn't square). No place for suitcases except on the floor next to the bed. Miniscule wardrobe with 4 hangars and no drawers. Bathroom similarly scaled - you could brush your teeth while seated on the toilet. When I asked for a different room they said they were fully booked. I suspect we got the dregs because we got there at 10pm.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for value and service”
Reviews.Author: McGintys
Reviews.Content: We wanted a clean, comfortable hotel within walking distance of Termini railway station and close to major historical sites of Rome. Hotel Sonya delivered. Staff were friendly and knowledgeable of the area. Room was modern and larger than the standard size. Breakfast was good and included in price. Internet access available in reception free of charge. Plenty of restaurants and places to get lovely Italian ice cream nearby. Laundromat just a few blocks away. Great value - thoroughly recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location/Great Service”
Reviews.Author: vicki002_11
Reviews.Content: Truly a gem within walking distance to all the historical sites of Rome. Just recently stayed for 2 nights post cruise the staff and service were 5*. Beautiful old building restored and the rooms were clean and larger than I was expecting. It came with a Breakfast included in your rate. I would definitely stay with them again!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sonya - great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: gerilync
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed in this nice hotel on our last night in Italy. The rooms, like most European hotels, were small but that was expected. The staff were very accommodating and helpful. The breakfast was included in the price and had a pretty full menu. The hotel is close to and in walking distance to a lot of sites. Wi-fi is included in the price but for only 6 hours and for one computer per room, although there are computers in the hotel reception area. I would highly reccommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: NelVB
Reviews.Content: Our Italy trip couldn't have started any better than our first hotel stay at Sonya. The location was exceptional - close to Roma Termini, in a clean, safe neighborhood and excellent room amenities - free wifi, modern italian furnishings and room facilities, Don't expect 5star accommodations, but for the cost, it was more than worth it and rivals other 3 star hotels we stayed at in Naples, Venice, Florence and Milan! The clean Metro line was around the corner and it was VERY easy to get a 3 day pass to get anywhere around central Rome. We also effortlessly took the Metro to a bus stop that took us out to the San Callisto Catacombs just outside of the central area. The staff were absolutely fantastic and accommodating, willing to help us out at every opportunity. We were moved from the original Sonya facility to its sister, and newer, facility just across the street - no hassle, the staff carried our luggage and allowed us to eat breakfast even if we arrived earlier than check in. Our room was ready 6 hours before check-in, which was a God-send, since we arrived at 8am due to the time difference. that was such a blessing for us to recover from jet lag and get some rest before beginning our Rome explorations! The staff confirmed our booked tours for us and totally went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. You won't be sorry! This is a GREAT hotel in a central location -- and EXCELLENT restaurants, shopping and sites! BEAUTIFUL church around the corner that we attended Sunday services in. WOW! What a deal!

Reviews.Title: “Good option for overnight stay in Rome before traveling home”
Reviews.Author: Enj0ytheView
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a night at Hotel Sonya the night before flying back to the US because it was close to Termini. My first reaction to the hotel was that it was dingy and out-dated. The staff was appropriate, but not overly helpful. We asked for a cheese shop close by to stock up on Italian cheeses before traveling home and we were directed to a convenient store close by. Termini neighborhood is a more "colorful" part of Rome compared to other locations but the close proximity to the station makes it worth it. The room we stayed in was not as nice as the photos online. The decorations were very minimal and, although the room looked clean, I had a sense that rooms was unsanitary. The breakfast that was included was not good. The breakfast included processed foods and baked goods. The hotel served its purpose, however, I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: HedyS
Reviews.Content: I recently was in Rome and stayed at the Hotel Sonya....quaint small rooms but very clean and staff was nice and very helpful. Good location to all the main sites about 20 minutes from Trevi Fountain. A little longer to Spanish Steps but with good walking shoes it gave you a feel for Rome. Loved the old time elevator and a nice breakfast was included. Would recommend it to travelers who want something a little off the beaten path. Not far from the train station, about a 5-7 minute walk and across the street from the opera house. If you have big luggage walking can be a little awkward as streets are cobblestone.

Reviews.Title: “Great option for inexpensive room in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Suzski
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel for one night pre-cruise based on Rick Steves recommendation. When we arrived a little after 10:00 am our room was ready and we were able to check in and drop our bags in our room before heading out to see the sites (which the Front Desk staff helped us with on a map they have). The metro is a short walk (8-10 minutes) but we spent our first day walking around the city. On the second day, we had reservations to tour the Vatican and were able to leave our bags at the hotel after we had checked out, since we had transportation that would be picking us up at 2:30 to take us to our ship. As other reviewers have stated, there is free wifi available. There are computers in the lobby available for use, and there are passwords (good for 6 hours) that you can get from the front desk to use in your room....you can get an unlimited number of these. The room is simple but clean and suited us just fine as we spent all our time out in the city. We would definitely use this hotel again on a future trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sonya in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Buzzbuzz1
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean, did not have nice views, but it is located in the theater area and safe. Their WiFi system is kind of weird, in that you have to get a new user name and password every 6 hours and even then, it is so so as far a connection. The breakfast is quite nice with a good variety of well made foods.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and modern but very small room”
Reviews.Author: Unkn0wn
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife only stayed for a night in this hotel as we had to catch a cruise ship from Civitavecchia so I wanted a hotel near Termini station. When we arrived they transferred us to the newer section of the hotel which is an apartment converted into hotel rooms with ensuite shower inside a building with other residents. There is a receptionist and even a small breakfast hall. Staff were excellent. Free wifi is a bonus too. Our Twin room was modern , comfortable and clean but unfortunatly it was very small. Much smaller than our bedroom at home. Lcd tv was good. Location is just 5 to 10 mins walk from Termini. Breakfast is nothing major but good.

Reviews.Title: “Rick Steves recommendation”
Reviews.Author: zaydeboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night at this hotel, near the Termini Station. The staff was very attentive, the room was clean. The bathroom was spacious. Unfortunately the mattress was like sleeping on a table. The continental breakfast was adequate and check in and out was fast. Not sure we could go there again since the bed was so uncomfortable. A small discount is offered for Rick Steves readers when paying in cash.

Reviews.Title: “good value and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Mark901
Reviews.Content: price to quality of facilities translate to good value. staff is excellent, highly commendable in providing personalized attention. close proximity to terminal station, ideal for train/bus transfers within and to other cities. clean bathrooms, comfortable bed, hot breakfast. rick steves got it right!

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: piton5318
Reviews.Content: Stayed in twin room for seven nights with my wife. Room was spotless,but breakfast was not good considering it is a budget hotel, and a good location - short walk along metro station. Warning!!! - Rooms is very small!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: YJulia
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near Termini station (about 5 min walk). The service is good, our room was on the 5th floor, it was clean, spacious and cosy. The service is good. Breakfast was a bit poor, but for 3star hotel it was ok. The only thing we didn't like - our room wasn't ready when we arrived (1.00 p.m.)

Reviews.Title: “Good option for a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: WanderLSP
Reviews.Content: For a lower priced hotel, it is a very good option. It is very clean and the staff is very nice and helpful. Breakfast is pretty big too. Free internet and wifi. It's close to the train station which is nice when you arrive, but not as great when you walk to see the sights, but that's how they can be cheaper. The walls were very thin, but our sound machine (free iPhone download!) did the trick.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality at It's Best!”
Reviews.Author: JILLYCP
Reviews.Content: Within Walking distance from Termini & Reppublica , Hotel Sonya is an affordable & well-staffed hotel. Employees are eager to please. Hotel has quaint elevator in center of the building. Good breakfast, cakes, cappuccino, fruit, cereal. Our 5th floor room had a big bathroom with large shower (hard to find in Rome). Big flat screen TV, cheap mini bar. Excellent experience. Thanks, Hotel Sonya for a memorable stay. We will surely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great and very friendly helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: DWG10
Reviews.Content: Perfect location in a not to crazy busy area but located close enough to walk to most beautiful sights including the Termini. Great folks at the front desk, And in the breakfast room all always willing to help you. Room was a little tight but still worked for the family of 4. We would stay here again anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasently Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: jpcck
Reviews.Content: First impression, a small hotel close to Termini train station. An antique elevator that was kind of iffy, but the surprise came as we walked in the actual hotel room. The first thing we saw was the extremely clean & sparkling bathroom. Everything had been remodeled (looked like very recently). The bathroom was large & comfortable. The room itself was also large for European standards. We were in room 549, which was a triple. The TV (a 42" LG flatscreen) was also a welcomed surprise. The helpful staff, always friendly, & ready to recommend nearby moderately priced restaurants & other helpful information was a plus. Also a plus was the complimentary WIFI & awesome breakfast, We will definitely return to the hotel Sonya when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it !”
Reviews.Author: Worldpeople123
Reviews.Content: Front desk people and waiters are the most helpful and friendly you would want to find. Everybody did their best to ensure you had an unforgettable stay. Excellent location, lovely breakfast, and best people come together for a wonderful time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel with delicious breakfast and attendant staff.”
Reviews.Author: lindamaeDunedin
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in Rome. Good location, great staff, very helpful and great breakfast and coffee, cappuccino, expresso to start the day.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful what room you choose.”
Reviews.Author: labtrav2
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed here for 3 nights in a room that was meant for 2 people. I thought I had booked the 'Family room' which sleeps 5 and looked fairly roomy on the internet but what I got was a 'Quad' room which is a double room to which they add 2 single beds. This made it extremely tight quarters for the 4 of us. There was less than a foot between the beds and very little room between the foot of the beds and the desk/closet areas. We asked to switch to the bigger room or even to get another double room but they were full. Despite all that we were generally happy with the hotel. The bathrooms were newly remodeled and, although tiny, were nicely done. The breakfast was quite nice with freshly baked coffee cakes, fruit, cereal, breakfast casseroles and more. The internet service was free and reliable and the elevator worked. This is important as the rooms are all on upper floors.

Reviews.Title: “it was a very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: josiemonaghan
Reviews.Content: We stay in this Hotel for 4 nights on a recent trip to Rome, It was very convenient to all the sights The Hotel was very clean and staff very friendly, polite and helpful Anything we asked, it was not a problem. We will be back again

Reviews.Title: “Loved our time at Hotel Sonya”
Reviews.Author: SonalH
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Sonya during our recent stay in Rome this month. Within walking distance from Roma Termini makes it ideal for exploring the city. The hotel staff greeted us warmly and gave excellent recommendations for restaurants and cafes. Whenever we called down to the desk our requests were fulfilled within minutes. Breakfast every morning was a delight!!! The staff made coffee, fresh cappuccinos and espressos. Our rooms was clean, quiet and very comfortable. High ceilings and controlled ac. There are newly renovated rooms on the 5th floor, so ask if those rooms are available when you book ;) We stayed 2 consecutive weekends and so on our return we got the newer room. But the non-renovated rooms are nice as well just not with the modern touches.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem!”
Reviews.Author: spikeSanDiego
Reviews.Content: The rooms were comfortable and clean. The breakast was fantastic- so much food and served in a lovely dining room with china and table cloths. The location is within walking distance from the train terminal and major sites such as the Forum as well as cute little cafes for dinnner. The owners are so nice- they let us store our suitcases there for the day when we returned from our cruise even though we weren't staying there that night. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near Termini”
Reviews.Author: sarne
Reviews.Content: We had booked Opera Hotel by booking.com and the booking hadn't come through. We were taken to Hotel Sonya instead, just 100 meters from Opera Hotel. We got room 540. The room was okay, with good air condition, but somewhat mended in the corners. The breakfast was great, better than at a 4 star hotel in Napels we had stayed at. Wifi worked so-and-so. On Thursday morning there was a street market on the backside of the hotel. The guys in the reception, mostly indians or pakistanies, gave good recommendation for different activities to do in the city. We tried the, by many, recommended restaturant around the corner (forgot its name but you go left and left from hotel door) and the choice was very good. Recommending the saltimmo du bucca (sorry about the spelling). A big NO-NO is to take a taxi from Termini station to Hotel Sonya. We were tired and took a taxi from Termini to Hotel Opera (i.e. Hotel Sonya) and the little bugger charged us €20 for this trip. Walk instead, it is just 5 minutes from Termini.

Reviews.Title: “A++ hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: TourEiffelUSA
Reviews.Content: just 10 mn away by foot from Termini -we used the hotel pre- and post- cruise. We got off the train from FCO airport and Civitavecchia and walked there. our room was ready both time when we checked at 4:30 p.m. and noon!!! we stayed on the 5th and 3rd floor the 2nd stay. It is clean, the front desk is very friendly, breakfast was very copious - we were even able to get some to go on our last morning while picked up at 6:30 a.m. - Rooms are small but new - beds were new - remember you're in Europe (hotel rooms and showers are smaller than the US) but when in Rome, well you'll spend so much time walking around discovering the city - the room is just to sleep right ;) there are laptops in the lobby - you can take one to your room for free - the only issue we never got it to work in the room - but was perfect for my husband to charge his cell phone and just checking emails in the lobby was enough. I'd recommand that little gem to anyone - you can walk anywhere from here to Rome or catch a metro 1 block away from Republica. Advise - pay cash (8% discount - that's great when the Euro is stronger than the USD) - and ask for the Rick Steve's price through the hotel website - we got a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in Rome”
Reviews.Author: birchkat
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not in a busy area of Rome, but it felt safe and comfortable. It is across the street from the opera house, and after a certain time you must use your key card to open the front door that leads to the lobby (which made me feel secure coming in late at night). The people at the desk were helpful and friendly, and the room was surprisingly beautiful and clean for the low price we paid. The floors were marble, which was refreshing in the heat, and the air conditioner worked wonderfully. The highlight of Hotel Sonya for me, in addition to the positives listed above, was the breakfast. We ate many breakfasts throughout our trip, but this one was by far the best. The pastry chef works at the hotel and comes around to offer drinks or anything else you may need during your meal. He makes a delicious vegetable dish that has baked vegetables inside with a layer of crust on the top and bottom. He also makes cakes such as yogurt cake and croissants. Their selection of fruit was good, and they had toppings (nutella, jam, etc.) available. The hotel is also a short walk to the Colosseum and the Forum, and it is a short taxi ride to most of the city. All in all, this was a wonderful hotel and a great way to end our Italy vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, fine accommodations.”
Reviews.Author: Fra-roberto
Reviews.Content: Modern rooms, powerful air-conditioning (a respite during the July heat), a yummy free breakfast (don't miss the vegetable pie), friendly helpful staff. A bit out of the way which wouldn't be a problem in cooler weather, but in the Summer heat required frequent taxi rides (which the hotel staff will gladly arrange within minutes). I'll definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Small but lovely.”
Reviews.Author: clarefromthebeach
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased when we arrived to our room at Hotel Sonya (we were taken down the road to Sonya Suite which is newly renovated). Our room was small but really clean and beautifully renovated. We had booked a superior room so this is probably why we were in the nicer part of the hotel. The staff were lovely (save the grumpy breakfast lady who seemed to have a problem with letting us have milk for our tea!) The location is very convenient and though we wanted to stay in a trendier area such as around Navona I think we got very value for money. I would definitely recommend this hotel for it's value.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Secondjay
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Sonya is a gem in the city of Rome. The rooms are clean, and the air conditioning is strong. The continental breakfast is one of the best I've ever had. The building is charming, and the staff is very helpful. Free Internet access in the lobby is a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Reza, and the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MDelReal
Reviews.Content: We are a family of three. My husband, my little girl and me. We booked at Hotel Sonya, but actually stayed at Sonya suites. We met Reza, who was very helpful and friendly. The room was very clean and spacious. The hotel is near the nice part of Termini Station, which was what we were looking for. I do recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in Rome”
Reviews.Author: fun2travel68
Reviews.Content: It may not look like much from the outside, but once inside you'll discover a hidden gem of a hotel! Our family of five, each with own backpack and rolling luggage, was able to easily walk to and from the Roma Termini train station. Upon arrival, they offered us cold water and stored our luggage until we checked in later. We found everyone to be friendly and helpful, especially the kitchen staff. Breakfast was superb – quiche, eggs, bread, nutella, baked goods, ham, yogurt, fruit and cereals. We thoroughly enjoyed the newly renovated rooms on the fifth floor which were clean and spacious with comfortable beds. The kids liked the vintage elevator with its cage door and suspended weights, but it's extremely small. Allow for extra time riding the elevator to get luggage down to the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: cyndywill
Reviews.Content: The service is excellent. The breakfast very good. They provided a map of Rome that was very useful. The staff is very friendly and polite. I found if you are friendly, even if we all are struggling with the language differences, everyone is friendly and helpful. The air conditioning was great in the room. It sure got hot in Rome. There is lots of stairs and a great "old time" elevator. The elevator works great only 4 people. The location was near many restaurants, and even a McDonald's if you needed a fix. All of our rooms were very nice and I love that you can open the windows for fresh air if you want to. This hotel is just blocks away from the Train station / subway which is an added feature for this choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: DSD069
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights. This is the perfect location from which to tour Rome. It is about a seven minute walk from the main train station. We also walked to all the main attractions from the hotel. (Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Colosseum) Our room was clean and comfortable and the air conditioner worked well. We heard very little street noise thus ensuring quality sleep. We found the staff to be very helpful with directions and in answering any other questions that we had about Rome. The breakfast was quite good. It was a cut above the continental breakfast we were getting at other hotels in Europe. We would definitely recommend Hotel Sonya for those going to Rome. It has nice rooms, helpful staff, and the location can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jenhod1
Reviews.Content: Positives: Staff is very friendly and did help when asked. Rooms were clean. Close to Termini station. Negatives: Wi-fi very unpredictable. Beds and pillows very uncomfortable. Shower did not drain very well. Air conditioning definitely lacking. Overall: We would try another hotel before going back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: MontclairLinda
Reviews.Content: Being near the train station, subway, and walking distance to most sights made this a convenient hotel to be at. We were offered a room in their newer location and we enjoyed having a very comfortable bed and modern bathroom. The staff were helpful and let us have some breakfast before the usual time on the morning that we had an early tour. The availability of WiFi gave us the opportunity to check up on our email from home.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: jq_kq
Reviews.Content: As part of a Heart of Italy, Rick Steves tour, we stayed at the Hotel Sonya for the last 2 nights of our trip and then an extra night afterward. It was an excellent choice. It was very conveniently located near the Termini station (for buses or trains) and we could walk virtually anywhere from it. The room was a nice size, had all the amenities needed, and was very comfortable. It was on the 5th floor so we often used the elevator, which was quite old and the kind I've only seen in the movies (complete with cage door to open upon exiting). This is no complaint. It added to the character of the hotel for sure. Breakfasts were very nice too, although the hot foods didn't stay hot for long. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “No hotel response to request for reservation”
Reviews.Author: GMSinger
Reviews.Content: Based on TripAdvisor reviews and Rick Steves listing, we wrote for a reservation. Initially, we got an immediate reply. We wrote back (twice) through the hotel's website changing the dates, but after 3 days, we have not yet had any reply or acknowledgement from the hotel. We will, therefore, be forced to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: cleonile1
Reviews.Content: Having read all the reviews praising this hotel, we were optimistic, and not disappointed when we arrived. It's a lovely, charming hotel in an ideal location for all modes of transport and even walking distance from some of the main sites and monuments. The hotel is kept spotlessly clean and the staff are so pleasant and friendly. Our thanks go especially to Imma who keeps the rooms spotlessly clean, and to the breakfast staff who always start your day with a smile and make you feel welcome. We wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Hotel Sonya to anybody travelling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: mktgt
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sonya was fine, but given how often it pops up online and is (supposedly) soooo highly recommended by Rick Steeves, it really was no different from any other budget to medium priced hotel. Rooms were tiny - as was the bathroom and the elevator. The front desk was not particularly helpful either. Breakfast staff was very pleasant. Location of hotel was very good, close to train station but in a nicer section than other hotels that are close to Termini. So don't be misled by the frequency with which this hotel pops up when looking for a hotel in Rome....it's not really special.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: teachermom49
Reviews.Content: Great location. Friendly, knowledgeable and helpful staff. Excellent breakfast. Rooms small, but spotless.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place and location”
Reviews.Author: ahsbooks
Reviews.Content: This was our first night in Rome and we were pleasantly surprised by how nice the hotel was. It looked as if it had been remodeled recently and it was very nicely maintained and very clean. The AC worked great and the street noise was not loud (we were on the 5th floor). It was a great location, very close to Termini train station which made it very easy to catch trains to everywhere in Italy. We stayed at another hotel in Rome and were wishing that it was as nice as the Hotel Sonya. Great place!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice staff, but not a good night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: Avery_1313
Reviews.Content: We arrived on June 12, 2011 and found the staff to be friendly and attentive. The room was simple but, overall, clean. We would highly recommend that the hotel update its bedspreads since they were not just dated, but worn out. The shower was incredibly small and was barely useful since you can't move once you step in. The worst part of our 2 night stay was being awakened very early both mornings. The first morning we were awakened at 8:00 a.m. by the maids. The second morning we were awakened at 6:45 a.m. by the guest next door who was using the bathroom. If you are assigned to Room 329, please be aware that the toilet in the room next door is adjacent to the headboard of your bed! When it flushes, it is extremely loud. Needless to say, we were a bit annoyed by the lack of sleep. However, the free use of the hotel computers and Wi-Fi are great, the breakfast is plentiful, and the location is very good. Close to the train station and shopping; not close to very many good restaurants. Definitely not a luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and highly recommend it”
Reviews.Author: Quilter_1947
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is superb! It's very quiet in the area. You'll love the friendliness. *** Watch out if you use an ATM just a few doors away because there will be someone step up to the ATM and start pushing the buttons and another will step up to totally distract you and they will try to get your money out of the ATM.***

Reviews.Title: “Fairly good hotel near Termini”
Reviews.Author: prasenberg
Reviews.Content: Having been to Rome close to twenty times, I picked this hotel because family of mine stayed in a hotel not far from the Hotel Sonya. I book a hotel closer to the centre myself usually. Still, being close to Termini does have its advantages and the neighbourhood is quite nice actually. There is a metro stop not too far and there are buses everywhere, so you can get around easily. The hotel itself is quite nice. I was a bit unfortunate that they gave me room 328, which is impossibly small (and I am 2 meters tall!). It can't have been more than 8 m2, if that. But other rooms are better. The shower was really small too, but once you're in, it's quite nice. Breakfast is not very special. The coffee was really bad, but they make up for that with cakes and pastries that are quite nice. The hotel offers free wi-fi in the room and that worked very well. Actually, I've never seen it work so well in any hotel room in Rome before. All in all, it wasn't a bad experience. Make sure you avoid room 328 though :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: RichardHarry
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights on our first ever trip to Rome with my wife, her sister and our adult niece. First off, the location is excellent as it is 3 blocks from the Stazione Termini which is the ending (and beginning) terminal for trains, subways and buses which made it very convenient for transportation. Be sure to buy the Roma Pass. Getting to the Vatican and other sites was very easy and quick. However, Rome is also a very walkable city. From the Sonya, we walked to the Coliseum, the Forum and then to lunch, ending at the Spanish Steps. Be aware, however, that this is a lot of walking althought it is mostly flat and I had little problem, even while awaiting a second hip replacement, except for the distance.. The hotel itself is very Italian, with marble entries, attentive staff and an old fashioned elevator with wire gates. The rooms were basic but spacious, well maintained and had windows that actually opened across from the Opera House so one can listen to the City sounds day or night. We often found cleaning staff in the hallways diligently working. The only complaint I had about the room was one had to turn sideways to enter the shower. Also, to get ice for cold drinks after a long day sightseeing, you have to go to the front desk . The breakfasts were typically Italian but good and hearty, with cold eggs, ham, fruit and rolls. Although it was self serve, the wait staff were very friendly,humorous and competent with bringing us divine capuccinos; we usually had at least 2 each, sometimes more. The front desk staff was very helpful with directions and restaurant recommendations. We originally found the Sonya on Trip Advisor and would visit it again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room with helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: lmsbw70
Reviews.Content: Our room was upgraded for free, for what reason, I don't know. Our room was very nice and clean. The staff was extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable”
Reviews.Author: EtnaVesuvius
Reviews.Content: location was great if you wanted to walk to all the sites as they were all close by.not ideal though as you did do a lot of walking when you got colosseum and vatican city.I suggest you get on a site seeing bus but dont make the mistake we did.One stops at 7pm and the green one stops at 11pm which is better value for 2 euros extra each.you can hop on and off all day.

Reviews.Title: “Roma, We'll Return One Day”
Reviews.Author: galeangela
Reviews.Content: From the start, Ivan and Rana were very helpful at the Sonya Hotel in Rome. Whether it be more ice, help on the computer, suggestions for dinner, or directions to a particular monument or site, these two men were "right on." In the morning I enjoyed home-made pastries and a delicious cup of cappuccino, always delivered with a smile. You take a centrally located hotel, recommended by Rick Steves himself, and add it to a knowledgeable,friendly staff and you have success

Reviews.Title: “Great Location by Tremni Station and sites, very clean and recently renovated.”
Reviews.Author: Big-Man1951
Reviews.Content: This is a very convenient location by the train station. You can actually do a easy 30 minute stroll to the Trevi Fountain and other great sites. A bus 1 block away will take you near all the major sites. The room was a very nice size, very clean and freshly painted. The hotel attendant helped with the luggage and was a wealth of information on the sites, history and transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly room on 3rd floor”
Reviews.Author: alina12
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 336 just a few days ago. The room has been redone, not large, but serviceable. The bathroom is small and the sealant is non existant at the base of the shower so that water leaks out during the shower and soaks the bathmat. A faint smell of sewage greets you when you enter the room. We tolerated it because the air conditioning helped to mask the smell. When we told the front desk, they were not able to move us until the third day, so we decided to stay put. Breakfast was extremely good as others have noted. Wi fi is free, but the signal is not always strong enough. The staff is genuine and helpful for the most part. The area is easy to walk around, many good eateries, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed to say the least.”
Reviews.Author: mehtap3
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been traveling all over Europe for the past 3 weeks and we have stayed in some really nice paces. All based on trip advisor ratings, and we have always come out delighted. Hotel Sonya was the only exception. A lot of the reviews below are by people who got to stay in the new 5th floor rooms, I got the 3rd floor room and boy what a disappoinment it was. We had a late checkin, the person at the front desk when I asked him politely if I could get a 5th floor room was very rude and told me I shoul have emailed them and he went in and in instead of politely saying no. Then he forgot to give us the usernam password for wireless. In the room the toilet paper roll was empty not replaced. The room was so tiny I barely fit in the shower stall. There was no way to contact the reception, I had to go down to ask the same person at the desk how to dial the reception. Everything seemed so old- the furniture, th beds, the blinds. Oh and there is no housekeeping late in the night to help you with something. Example: we wanted an extra towel I had to go down to the reception to ask for ne and I was tol they dont have one, I asked him to check inside and guess what they had one, the person was too lazy to go check. The safe in th room was not digital... Out of 10 hotels we stayed in this was the only one. I didn't feel safe putting my valuables in safe with a key not knowing who else might have a duplicate. Te reason I booked is hotel is that, they were offering a promotion of 2 free tickets forbth open bus tour. When I asked them for it they said that the "green line tour " was not operating in June 2nd for national day, w asked around and that tour was on strike. When I asked for the other tour tickets they refused, I felt really cheated. The hotel is in a building with other residents who have their home there, something that really put me off. It looks like a dump and my wife and I did not feel safe in the area. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant family run hotel with terrific breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: drfumblefinger
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at this hotel because of it's proximity to the Termini Train station and recommendation in Rick Steves guidebook. Also, when we looked at the Tripadvisor rating was fairly good. We were not disappointed. It's a small family run hotel of 3 star quality. The rooms are nice, nothing luxurious, but with a pleasant appointments, free inroom internet, and a comfortable quiet night's sleep. The family that runs the hotel was very pleasant and helpful. The breakfast spread was terrific, with fresh baked pastries (including a wonderful vegetarian pastry) and a variety of cakes. We'll stay here again when we go to room. If you're looking for luxury then this isn't the place. If you want a place for a fair price of nice quality then I'd highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: mariadim3000
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights in Sonya Hotel. the room was not very big but it was well furnished and clean. the breakfst was excellent and the staff really helpful with everything. one of the best things was the location near the station,although the area wasn't very nice. it's not so expensive and it's truly worths the money

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Comfort, and Value”
Reviews.Author: savvytraveler68
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the Hotel Sonya for four nights in April of 2011. Upon our arrival, we were told that a room was available in the hotel's recently renovated annex. A staff member promptly escorted us to the annex, located half a block to the north on Via Firenze. Bear in mind that comments in this review concerning the room and amenities pertain only to the Hotel Sonya's annex, not to the main portion the hotel. We chose the Sonya primarily for its location, about a quarter of a mile northwest of the main Termini train station in central Rome. It takes about 10 minutes to walk from the hotel to the station entrance, plus another 5 to 10 minutes to reach the platforms (15 for the airport train platform). In other words, the hotel is close enough to the station to be convenient, but just far enough removed to provide some distance from the noise and congestion. The neighborhood in which the hotel is located is relatively modern (mid to late 19th century). It's not among the most atmospheric parts of Rome, but it is very convenient for accessing most parts of central Rome on foot or via public transit. It takes about 25 to 30 minutes to walk west to the Trevi Fountain or north to the Villa Borghese. If you don't want to walk, you can take one of several bus routes into the center on nearby Via Nazionale. Also within easy walkding distance is the Repubblica metro stop, from which you can access the Vatican or the Colosseum. Our room in the annex was comfortably furnished and included a small flat panel television mounted above the desk. A large wardrobe unit contained ample storage space as well as a safe for valuables. Another nice feature was the balcony, which provided plenty of fresh air and made us feel like we were part of the neighborhood, even though the view (across the street to the side of the opera house) was less than spectacular. We experienced little traffic noise, as Via Firenze is not a major thoroughfare. The windows are well-insulated and do a good job of keeping out what noise there is when they are closed. We only used the ceiling-mounted air conditioning unit briefly, but it was quiet and capable of cooling the room quickly when needed. The bathroom was relatively large by Roman standards. At first glance, it looked a bit retro with lots of vintage marble on the walls, but the fixtures and the plumbing had been updated. There was even a jacuzzi tub, although the on/off switch was inconveniently located inside the bedroom. Everything in both the room and bathroom was clean and tidy. A complimentary continental breakfast buffet was served on the ground floor of the Hotel Sonya's annex. It provided a good selection of cold foods, including a vegetable tart, hard-boiled eggs, yogurt, indivdually wrapped portions of proscuito and salami, some fresh fruits, and various baked goods, plus coffee prepared to order. The staff members we encountered in the breakfast room and at the front desk were consistently friendly and helpful. When booking our room online, we took advantage of the 5 percent discount if payment is made in cash upon departure. The cash discount saved us 30 euros off the price of the room, which helped to offset the fact that the euro had appreciated against the dollar between the time we planned our trip and the time of our depature. With the cash discount, we paid just under 150 euros per night for our room, which we felt was reasonable considering the central location and the quality of the accommodations. We also appreciated not be charged for the bottled water we consumed from the mini bar. The Hotel Sonya annex met all of our expectations. It proved to be a good choice for our first visit to Rome, providing a good degree of comfort and easy access to most parts of the city at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Colee626
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very modern and clean, but extremely small. You won't spend much time in the room anyway. It's located close to the train station and easy walking distance to many sites and the Metro. Breakfast was good and served early if you need it. The staff was friendly. They offered us a laptop in the room, very easy!

Reviews.Title: “Good room, good breakfast, fantastic people.”
Reviews.Author: 50bdaycelebrant
Reviews.Content: From the hotel clerks to the staff in the breakfast area these folks make you feel welcome and are eager to help you find restaurants, attraction tickets or transportation.
