The room we stayed in (552) was in the newer area and was well appointed. The hotel wasn't easy to find even though it is directly across from the Opera House (second to the last door from the end of the block farthest from the train station - no sign visible from the street) but it was well worth the search. Largest elevator we encountered during our trip which made it easier to get our luggage to the fifth floor.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a good location for exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: Islanders09
Reviews.Content: We (my husband and I, along with another couple) spent 4 nights at Hotel Sonya in May. The hotel is located about a 5 min walk from the main train station (Roma Termini), and we had not issues walking to the hotel from there with all our luggage, not necessary to get a taxi. It is about a 20 min walk from the hotel to the Colosseum (shorter if you take some small side streets), and about 45 min walk to Vatican city. It is very easy to get to Vatican City on the underground from the hotel as well, the stop is about 5 min walk from the hotel and is 1 euro for the 5 min subway ride which stops about 6-7 blocks from the Vatican (the hotel can advise the name of the stops). The hotel is sort of on the perimeter of the main tourist area, but if you enjoy walking and exploring (like we do) its a great place to stay. The rooms were clean and a good size for European hotels, the bathroom was a bit small but sufficient and clean. My only complaint with the rooms is that the mattress' were quite hard and not that comfy to sleep on. The breakfast was pretty good, not a huge selection but sufficient, and it was pretty well stocked whether you ate at 8am or 10am. There is free wifi at the hotel also. The hotel certainly meant our expectations and I would stay there again if I returned to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A Study in Contrasts”
Reviews.Author: SuzieQ044
Reviews.Content: We had decided to spend 3 days in Rome, after returning from a 12-day cruise. I had researched hotels in Rome and so I was putting a lot of faith into what I read (in addition, Rick Steves had highly recommended this hotel). When we pulled up to Hotel Sonya, honestly, I thought I would die! My husband said, 'looks like a dump'.....The building is old and doesn't look much from the front. Our room on the 5th floor was just lovely; it was larger than we expected, newly-renovated, immaculate, and located in a rather quiet area, but very convenient to everything. The staff were so helpful and the free breakfast was absolutely delicious. We could walk to the Colosseum. Our three days in Rome were wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Maz9
Reviews.Content: I spent along time trying to find a hotel in Rome that had a central location and received good reviews on Trip Advisor and this was one of the few that came back with good reviews. It was a great choice. Central location for site seeing, close to station for trains and metro. The old fashioned lift made it vey quaint. We weren't expecting much for breakfast but we were pleasantly surprised by the choice and the staff were very accommodating if you wanted anything else. Free computers in reception, free wifi in the room. Only one thing that I would be negative about was the bathroom was quite small but apart from that a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location.”
Reviews.Author: birder50
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed here for 4 nights together and then my mother returned for a final night after her extended stay in Italy. We both agreed that it was a very good hotel for the price and more than met our expectations. The room was large and clean, the bathroom equally large and clean. Wi-fi connection in the rooms as well as computers downstairs in the lobby. The elevator was helpful as we walked a great deal each day and it felt like a treat to not walk up the stairs! Best part - it was an old open elevator with great ironwork. The rooms (my mother had a different room on her return) was quiet so that was helpful for sleep. The mattresses, in all of our accommodations, were more on the very firm side but that only made coming home to our own beds that much sweeter. Staff was very helpful once we got there although we had thought from their e-mail responses they would not be so helpful. They called cabs for us, made sure we were OK with our day's plans and asked after us. Babul walked me outside to show me where the grocery store was. There is a tiny pizza place just next door that was super good too. Breakfast was plentiful and the tea was good. Each room had an electric kettle as well as a mini fridge. Our friend, who joined us for the Rome portion of our trip, stayed in the Sonya Suites, just down the street and we were able to come and go out of each location without a problem.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel, in a good location with very helpful and accommodating staff”
Reviews.Author: BigOnBooks
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Sonya is located within reasonable walking distance from Termini, so that was a plus for us as we were traveling to the Amalfi Coast by train after seeing Rome. The rooms were not large but they were comfortable with telephone, TV and free Wi-fi access. The breakfast buffet offered a variety of pastries, cheese, coffee and juice plus fresh fruit. They would also make fresh espresso, lattes, cappuccinos. Extra points to the staff in the new section, who were all wonderful and did everything possible to make my stay a great experience. I would definitely stay there again. If you stay there, eat at caffetteria ristorante Il Palchetto, which is practically right next door at Via del Viminale, 48. Don't eat at LaMatriciana, #44.

Reviews.Title: “Silvia was wonderful and lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: maryrick82
Reviews.Content: Silvia who was at the front desk was so very helpful with suggestions for meals, on/off bus tours, and help with little questions that came up. She made sure the room reservations were done correctly. The hotel is conveniently located. Our room was small and lovely. Breakfasts are delicious - I miss their caffe latte already! Everything we could have hoped for.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and close to trainstation but nothing exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Hoya91
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night at this hotel and found it ok but not that special. The rooms are small and functional which is fairly normal for Rome. The hotel is clean and neat and our room faced away from the street so it was quiet. The breakfast is a rather small but pretty good buffet in a small windowless, but light room. The staff spoke English and were helpful enough. Don't take a taxi from the train station, it is only a few blocks to walk. The street is not very nice in itself but it is walking distance to a lot of sights.

Reviews.Title: “Gets the job done”
Reviews.Author: ss_1234q
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in April 2011. Given that it is a 3 stay hotel one can obviously not except too much. Pros: - Clean rooms - Very friendly staff - Location - close to Termini station and restaurants Cons: -Very small rooms, but this is expected. The shower however was very tiny. - Room could do with a bit more light.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant suprise”
Reviews.Author: filipmina
Reviews.Content: arrived in hotel april 3 2011 . Check in was fast and we got our room before official check in time . hotel in located in a building which still has some private apartments together with the hotel rooms , but except for the suprise this didn't have any impact on the quality of our stay . Room was newly renovated , lots of marble , bathroom very spacious , very modern , more than enough towels , shampoos etc . Beds were large and comfortable , new windows provided excellent protection from outside noise , room also had quite and quality air conditioning . we had the breakfast included in the price of our room . breakfast is more than adequate , lots of fresh pastry made in hotel kitchen , eggs , yogurts , and fresh fruits , also eggs in various ways , and good salamis , orange or apple juice. for me the the coffee was the best part , very rich and foamy and served by a waiter . this is a small hotel and staff is very attentive ,helpful and friendly . anything we needed was provided to us on a timely basis and with the smile . internet is free , also hotel staff helped us with the booking of a shuttle bus to get to the airport , give us advice how to get to places in rome we wanted to see , assisted me with the renting of a vespa scooter . this hotel is excellent value for your money , but the best part is the staff . for best deal use rick steve's rome travel book

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel with Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jadeblade49
Reviews.Content: A small hotel/apartment that has great location. It is within walking distance from the Termini Station so it is very convenient if you arrive by train. The metro station is also very close (Republicca). The room is quite small but clean and nice. Free Wifi in the room, free breakfast, helpful staff. If you get tired of Western food, there is a good and cheap Chinese Restaurant nearby. Very recommended !

Reviews.Title: “a wonderfull gem, right in the heart of rome”
Reviews.Author: rosed3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very small, the staff are great they were very helpfull.the breakfast buffett is very good, lots of selection.the hotel is in a great location easy to use the subway, trams and bus lines to travel around the city.The staff are really good about helping you find the cultural sites of the city as well as the little out of the way places.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: paaquinn
Reviews.Content: This way my first trip to Rome, the hotel Sonya and it's sister Hotel Opera was great. I live in Las Vegas and know good hotels. The staff were very helpful, I felt safe, rooms very clean, and centrally located, we walked every where. I will make the Hotel Opera my home away from home on my next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wise choice for those on a budget”
Reviews.Author: IrishTexasAggie
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I stayed four nights at the Hotel Sonya in Rome. It is located within walking distance to Termini Train Station. Our room was small, but most hotel rooms in Italy are. It was extremely clean and came with satelite tv. We are able to keep up with news back home in the states. We were also able to walk to all the sites in central Rome without a problem. The employees were very friendly and helpful. I would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We expected more from a 3 stars Hotel at this rate”
Reviews.Author: ZebWin51
Reviews.Content: Very cold and noisy room (noise coming from the high traffic in the street) Small and unpersonal restaurant only available for breakfasts Not far from Termini which is practical for travelers Kind people working there. Free access to Internet Coffee and teabags in the room (one of each per person)

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: shrilka
Reviews.Content: the worst hotel ever, terrible!! our room didnt even had a WINDOW!! the bed was terrible, the room was really small, in general, very very bad!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed based on other Reviews”
Reviews.Author: jenndoh
Reviews.Content: Front desk was friendly enough. The breakfast server was excellant. He was very friendly and quick to serve us. I must say I was disappointed based on the Tripadvisor reviews I had read. I wasn't expecting a luxury 5 star hotel but more than what we got. for our money Room was very outdated. We had water up to our ankles everytime we showered. It was a little bit better after maintainence came but still backed up. There was a horrible smell coming from the bidet so we had to keep the bathroom door closed when we were in the room. Outside noice was pretty bad that I kept thinking the window was open. We thought staying near the train station would be convienent but this area didn't have the character that other parts of Rome have. We paid the most per night for this hotel as opposed to the other 4 hotels we stayed in during our trip to Spain/Italy. Those other hotels far surpassed this hotel in accommodations and value. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cant go wrong!”
Reviews.Author: BonExplore
Reviews.Content: We arrived in rome and came out the wrong exit from the station but with our little pocket map, we found the hotel and realised if we had come out the main exit we would have got to the hotel by following just a simple road. It had the most amazing old fashion lift, beyond which was the reception, we checked our luggage in as we were too early to check in, so we went to get some food. There are sooo many lovely places to eat around there! The are is so lovely to just sit near a fountain and eat gelato all day long! We entered our room, which for the two of us was great. The bed was confortable - but watch out for the gap in the middle of the bed. The decor was great and cosy. The TV placed in a nice place (only 2/3 english channels) and most of all the Bathroom was nice too. I think we had found ourselves a lovely romantic hotel. Our 5 days went very quickly, everything is in wlking distance of the hotel. Rome can be very expensive for alcohol however if you smoke they are much cheaper than Britain. The hotel staff were very welcoming, everynight we returned late the hotel door would open automatically and the reception person would always give us a little wave. Its thhose little touches that make the difference. I love every moment in rome, it is the most beautiful city i have visited and me and my partner have decided we will come again very soon. Thanks you

Reviews.Title: “Clean&basic hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: aine24
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay.the hotel was in a great location between the termini and republica metro stations.I found the area very safe despite what I had read.we walked everywhere from the hotel,except to the vatican.we bought €1 one way metro tickets for this journey.our room was clean,with a large king bed and everything you need.the breakfast was basic but adequate and the breakfast staff were very friendly. Overall I'd recommend the hotel for anyone on a budget who wants somewhere clean,secure and within walking distance of the sights. Tips: go to the trevi fountain at midnight... Very romantic&mufh quieter than during th day. Buy Ur ticket for the colosseum/roman forum/palantine hill at the forum entrance as the queues are much smaller Precook your Vatican tickets,so glad we did when I spotted the huge line.we were able to go straight to security. Watch out for hidden service charges in restaurants... In one we were given a basket of stale bread at €3 per person.I asked them to take it away but was charged for it as they said the €3 included a service charge.this was not stated on the menu. Walk everywhere,its the best way to stumble upon hidden gems.we loved Rome and will definitely return to hotel sonya

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Will return definitely”
Reviews.Author: JC_Pan
Reviews.Content: Small,but great Hotel to stay in. Great location. Newly decorated rooms and window opens up to welcome the fresh air in. Carrefour supermarket just diagonally opposite and great to get water and necessities. Everything inside our hotel room was relatively new. A comfortable stay. Free internet. Breakfast, though not continental, has a special feel to it. Loved the potato pie and others. Definitely filling and a great way to start a day in rome exploring the great city.

Reviews.Title: “Great located”
Reviews.Author: Rens72
Reviews.Content: Very Nice hotel, with good service. Tip, rent à scooter for à day.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with our two night stay at the Hotel Sonya.”
Reviews.Author: esmtmc
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, we were told that our room was down the street -- while small, the room was clean and comfortable. Free Internet worked nicely, the hotel loaned us a laptop for our airline check-in, the beds were comfortable and the shower was great. The staff, especially Simonne, was quite helpful and friendly. Close to the airport shuttle which is one of the reasons that were chose the hotel. I've stayed in Rome several times and found The Hotel Simonne to be the best so far.

Reviews.Title: “Feel at home”
Reviews.Author: DutchDiva035
Reviews.Content: Three days in Rome en and have been in Hotel Sonya. Such a warm welcome, friendly,helpfull and make you feel home. Rooms are not that big, but very clean and 10 minutes walk from several highlights. Breakfast is excellent! Capuchino and homade cakes, fabulous!! All this for a very good price. We will be back!!! Thanks for the wonderful stay at Sonya! Dutch Diva's Bossina

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return to Hotel Sonya-all thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: SuThom
Reviews.Content: We picked Hotel Sonya after reading reviews on this site and it delivered - we preferred a hotel close to Termini as we knew after our long flight that we would want to walk there quick and start to explore the city. From check-in to check-out the experience was as good as it gets. The entire staff treated us and every other guest like family, we loved the breakfasts, the room was clean and the comfortable bed and pillows we miss. Having visited Rome before-we knew the location and its convenience to the Metro, buses, and within walking distance to so many sites on our must see list. The staff also recommended a local restaurant that we frequented a number of times - just around the corner. It doesn't get much better than Hotel Sonya for price/value.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly”
Reviews.Author: Nikolas086
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean room, very good breakfast, very good service and everybody was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Sonya was perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: jimandjo_10
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights in the Hotel Sonya and were thoroughly pleased with our stay there. The location was perfect for us, since it is very close to the Roma Termini station (easy walk) and in a safe neighborhood. The room was clean and comfortable and the service was great - they had even arranged an advance reservation for us at the Galleria Borghese (a MUST-SEE in Rome!). The breakfast buffet was excellent. If we return to Rome in the future, as I hope we will, we would not hesitate to stay again at the Hotel Sonya.

Reviews.Title: “Just excelent,location,room,service..no objections!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tanja1901
Reviews.Content: Already said..no objections,just perfect,for every kind of visit!

Reviews.Title: “BIg room, big value, a nice escape from a stressful city”
Reviews.Author: KellyCanada75
Reviews.Content: We arrived too early so we had to store our luggage and come back at 2pm. Not a big deal. The staff was very courteous and helpful. Our room was much bigger than we expected, which makes it nice to stay 4 days and be able to move around. Had spacious closet, and clothes storage. Big king size memory foam bed with extra pillows. there was a hidden sink and stove behind the extra bed, that we never used. Mini fridge with non expensive contents. Room 444 looked modern. Bathroom nice size with shower. Flat screen tv with many satellite music channels to drink wine to. Big breakfast buffet with many options for different tastes. They make their own homemade baked goods. My only complaint is that our room when we would walk in smelled like bathroom disinfectant after someone had used it. Yes, a slight sewer smell being covered up by cleaner. Maybe happened 2 of our 4 nights. Not enough for me to voice a complaint but enough to notice it and open our windows to lessen the smell. Overall, a great hotel for the value. If I had to be in Rome again (not a Rome lover, so not sure if I will return to Rome), I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! A Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: careymfm
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at Hotel Sonya and we're glad we did. The location is only a few blocks from the train station (Termini Roma--which incidentally has surprisingly good food and is like a mall) and if you go out the door of the hotel, straight down the street is a McDonalds for those who enjoy that kind of food!). You can also catch buses or the metro at the train station. We paid through Hotels.com ($103 per night which included a buffet breakfast and free Wi-Fi) and felt we got our moneys worth. We arrived early and they held our bags for us until we returned from sight-seeing. The hotel personnel are very helpful and kind. They even gave us a book on Florence that someone gave them and that my husband was looking through for the next leg of our trip and offered to buy. The hotel may not look like much from the outside but our room was beautiful. We were on the fifth floor so they took our bags up in a roomy elevator and we walked into a very elegant, modern-style, clean room with a comfortable king bed, a flat screen TV and lovely, up-to-date furnishings. It looked like it had just been remodeled with marble everywhere! The buffet breakfast was included in the price and was absolutely fantastic. There was bread, pastrami, cheeses, yogurt, assorted croissants, various pastry and desserts, boiled eggs, fruit and they served you your beverage. A stand out was the outstanding vegetable pie with flaky crust. The free WiFi (you get a user name and password) worked well on my iPhone but my husband had trouble with his on one day but then it worked better the next. We were able to Skype, Fring and email. We felt very safe here and in Rome for that matter. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Spotless, great location, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: rileysmom1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Sonya Hotel Nov 29 - Dec 2. In beautiful older buidling that is across and down a couple of doors from the Opera House. The lobby is on the ground floor but the hotel rooms are on the 4th floor (push 3 in the great old elevator) of a very quiet apartment building - gorgeous wooden doors to each apartment and beautiful marble steps. Close to Termini and Republica metro stop - easy 5 to 10 minute walk depending on traffic. Felt very safe walking around. Always lots of business people around in the daytime and lots of shoppers and diners and opera-goers out and about in the evening. Absolutely immaculate! Our room was small (how much time do you really spend in it anyway, when you are in Rome!?) but quiet and modern, although we found the mattress a little firm for our taste. Other rooms vary in size. Well-lit bathroom. In-room safe and coffee/tea setup. Staff very helpful, explained the room and breakfast well. Will help arrange tours or transportation if needed. Free use of 3 computers in the quiet lobby. Staff very helpful if you have any questions about their operation. Breakfast offerings included coffee-cakes, fresh fruit, yogurt, egg casserole, rolls, bread, ham, cheese, hard-boiled eggs, cereal. Staff on hand to bring you coffee/juice in 3 small, secluded dining areas. Could not have been nicer. We loved it. It was perfect for us. Great location to sights or transportation to sights and a great value. Will definitely stay there again when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Gina_Greece29
Reviews.Content: Nice and quiet location,friendly helpfull staff,good buffet breakfast,nice view(Opera) from room window. The only drawback was that the specific room was a little smaller than we expected(4th flooor).

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but really tiny room”
Reviews.Author: BeingUs
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Sonya for about 4 days in Jul '10. When we arrived we were told that our room has been booked in their new hotel a few buildings away. The room was incredibly small, with 2 adults and a 6-year old and our luggage, there was not much space to move around. That said, the room was very neat, comfortable bed, clean bathroom, but again very small. The staff were very courteous and cheerful, breakfast was adequate. Location is good, walking distance to the Termini.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, great value, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: JDHelm
Reviews.Content: In our recent trip through Italy, I booked all my hotels based on what they provide in terms of value. This one's perfect for Rome. Close to train station, within walking distance of everything other than maybe the Vatican, breakfast was pretty good too. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a great experience!”
Reviews.Author: MCL2010
Reviews.Content: Would definitely stay here again in the future! This trip was out of season. Freshly baked croissants & pastries for breakfast, helpful staff especially Ivan, very near the Termini train station and walking distance (if you like to walk) to Trevi Fountain & Spanish steps. Room was newly renovated, not very big but adequate for what we needed.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it”
Reviews.Author: Vern7
Reviews.Content: Room was small but very clean. Location was convenient, just a few blocks from Roma Termini. Free WiFi and breakfast were bonuses.

Reviews.Title: “best value”
Reviews.Author: dinos67
Reviews.Content: excellent location, excellent breakfast, excellent people.

Reviews.Title: “nice we hotel, great base for seeing rome”
Reviews.Author: footiemad7
Reviews.Content: ten min walk from the train station, really easy to find. check in no prob, room quite big with nice clean bathroom and had everything you needed although you do have to pay for the tea in the room so wouldnt be a bad idea to buy some tea bags or coffee in "de spar" and leave it in your room. breakfast was really good and the morning staff were more than helpfull, good selection of food and drinks. all main attractions are within walking distance if you are prepared to do a bit of walking, for example the furthest walk we did was to the vatican which was a gud 45 min walk but this way you got to see a lot more of rome. all in all an excellant hotel and trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent recommend highly”
Reviews.Author: GregE1
Reviews.Content: Room smallish but comfortable. Breakfast excellent Farhad- great cook and sense of humour. Staff Sanjoy and Ivan made you feel at home and were good tour advisors and sense of Humour.Our Italian wasn't great but there English made up for it.My wife and 20 year old daughter had a great introduction to Italy Thanks guys. Location was great and close enogh to station.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have chosen a better hotel for our first stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: TwinkleMitchell
Reviews.Content: I chose Hotel Sonya from all the great reviews on Trip Advisor, and we were not disappointed. We stayed for a long weekend to celebrate a 40th birthday. The hotel was 10 minutes walk from the Termini train station, and was really easy to find. We arrived really early and although the room was not ready, the staff were more than happy to take care of our cases for a few hours so we could stroll round before we checked in. The room was on the 5th floor, reached in a beautiful old style cage lift. We were shown to the room personally, and all the controls for the TV and air con were explained to us. The room was a lovely size, bed was huge, very clean with a double shower in the bathroom. The windows when closed let no noise in, and when used, the shutters kept the room dark. We were amazed at the proximity of the hotel to all the major attractions, we reached everywhere by walking - apart from the Vatican, which we used the metro from Republica station a few minutes walk away. When the staff realised we were celebrating a 40th birthday, they knocked the door with a bottle of wine and a letter to say 'happy birthday' which we thought was a really lovely touch. The breakfasts were great - we particularly enjoyed the pizza rustica! Warm croissants, ham, cheese, cereals and yoghurts were more than enough. The staff were so friendly and nothing was too much trouble, service was excellent and someone was always on hand with information and advice. The free wifi was a godsend too for being able to email all our photos home! We didn't use the mini bar but it was lovely to have a fridge in the room. There was a small supermarket (Carrefour) on the opposite corner of the street On checking out, the hotel again offered to watch our cases until we departed for the airport, which gave us time to get some last minute sightseeing in. I would definetely return to Hotel Sonya, and would without hesitation recommend it to friends. From the outside it looks small, but inside is wonderfully welcoming and friendly! Well done to all the staff!!

Reviews.Title: “THANKS FOR A MOST ENJOYABLE WEEK'S STAY AT HOTEL SONYA.”
Reviews.Author: Scott_SusanMukilteo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed very much the week we stayed at Hotel Sonya. The location is conveniently located for sightseeing by walking or by public transits. The room was comfortable and equipped with satellite television and air conditioning. The elevator is classic but efficient. After utilizing the hotel's lobby internet services and demonstrating our continued need for further services, the staff provided a loaner laptop for use in our room which was ideal. The staff was most helpful in assisting with our many questions and sightseeing reservation requirements. The staff was well managed, professional and yet projected a very friendly and almost family atmosphere. Well done to IVAN, FRANCESCA, FARHAD, JOY and ARIF.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: DnE_10
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Hotel Sonya numerous times. The owner and the staff (breakfast crew and desk clerks) are very friendly and very helpful. They have always gone out of their way to ensure our stay in Rome has been comfortable and enjoyable. Breakfast is good; cappuccinos are excellent. The breakfast staff is extremely accommodating and always ensures guests have everything that can be provided. We are always treated like family. On our latest stay, we had our daughter and Granddaughters with us. The girls were made to feel very special by the breakfast crew, headed by Fahad. We enjoy the cheerfulness of the breakfast staff - it is a great way to start our day. Rooms are neat, clean, quiet and comfortable and non-smoking rooms have always been available. Any concern and the staff is immediate in a resolution of the slightest concern or problem. The provision of free internet and a laptop, if required, is a big plus. We love to walk so the fact that the hotel is a short distance to Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and many other places of interest, is a bonus. Even a walk to Vatican City, which is about 4 kms from Hotel Sonya, is fun with all the gelato and cappuccino stops along the way. Great hotel, great staff, great location! Thanks Ivan, Fahad and the rest of the Hotel Sonya crew. Dawn and Ed (Calgary, Alberta, Canada)

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Hotel in a busy city”
Reviews.Author: kiwigardner
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sonya is in a quiet street just off Via National and near Termini station. Having stayed in the area before I knew it was a very handy area to stay, and after reading reviews on TripAdvisor felt safe in booking this hotel. We were very happy with the service, our room and the breakfast which was included. We had a quiet room so had no trouble sleeping, even after 28+ hrs traveling from New Zealand. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “CHARMING AND LOVELY”
Reviews.Author: PATSN
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Sonya was the perfect introduction to Italy. The hotel is strategically located. It is charming and warm. Like a big hug. The staff is wonderful. The breakfasts were a treat. The room was great for two single women. We loved this hotel and I would go back to it again.

Reviews.Title: “Room was too small”
Reviews.Author: Kentuckyytravelers
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sonya was a Rick Steves recommendation, and it was in a good location with an excellent breakfast. The lobby was pretty, the staff were friendly and helpful, but the room was so small we could hardly move around in it. We stayed in Italy for two weeks, with the first two nights in Hotel Oceania and the last two nights in Hotel Sonya. We paid the same price for each room but Hotel Oceania was by far the better experience. B&E

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Rome tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2thdrboyd
Reviews.Content: Found Sonya to be a great hotel with ideal location to venture out on extended day trips of sightseeing. Very clean room and a quiet neiighborhood-no night sirens, yet very close to Termini station. This hub works for ALL connections. We startd with the hop on hop off tour bus and stayed on until near the end at Trevi/Spagno. Then explored North Rome and hopped on nearly the last bus back to Termini. The Subway Metro all connects at Termini and the express train to the airport is so easy. After getting the big picture from the tour loop start picking out the area you want to visit the next day and it's 2 short blocks to all forms of transport. Buy the Roma Pass then you hop on and off whenever you want. We walked 8-15 miles a day as it was. Hotel Sonya was perfect for our 5 nights in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Overall I had a very nice stay and I would recommend it”
Reviews.Author: garwilfo
Reviews.Content: Overall I had a very nice stay and I would recommend it. I was a little taken back when I was escorted over to a different building a half block away called the Hotel Roma Opera where they had about 15 more rooms (I believe). Helpful staff spoke good English and the location was quite good though Rome is quite spread out so it's important to know that walking distances are a little far for the major attractions. I think the Trevii fountain was closest at a 10-15 minute brisk walk if you know where you are going. However I did not mind that because the neighborhood is great and is quite close to the Train station and the metro is even closer. The room including bathroom was very nice, the breakfast was great and internet usuage was good though not private (it was right in the small lobby area beside the front desk). They did have wifi in the rooms and they also had a few small but slow computers available to take to our own rooms. They did not have actual laundry facilities at this building as advertised. As long as the guest is aware of the facilities as they are, then this hotel is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, with helpful staff in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Sospan70
Reviews.Content: Stayed with other family members for a short break. Hotel was in a convenient location within easy walking distance of bus routes and small cafes and restaurants. Room was comfortable with a firm bed and a decent sized bathroom. Breakfast was more than adequate with a good choice of fruit, cereals and bread and cakes. Staff were always friendly and interested in providing a good level of service in all aspects. When we asked one of the cleaners (eastern european) to leave one of our rooms for a while whilst one of our party was resting, she phoned her english speaking daughter to translate to ensure that she fully understood our needs! Overall a good city centre hotel with the added attraction of free WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us!”
Reviews.Author: McWeberSTL
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sonya was a great spot for us. We like walking the city, and it was perfect walking distance between everything. The staff was very friendly, and the free internet access was a great bonus to be able to email home to family. Breakfast wasn't the best, but still good and filling.

Reviews.Title: “The Very Best Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: misharpittman
Reviews.Content: We were traveling ,3 sisters my niece and her 7 month old baby.We checked in to the hotel early and they made sure we were comfortable and arranged to have breakfast for us.We had been traveling since 2:30 that morning so we so appreciated their thoughtfulness.The whole staff at this hotel is the very best in every way we would highly suggest that you stay here during your stay in Rome, location is great ,superior staff and very nice rooms.Not one negative thing to say it was a great experience they made us feel like family,and they even escorted us to our cab at 4:30 in the morning as a group of women we really appreciated that.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff. Good location. Nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: grp_10
Reviews.Content: Extremely accomodating staff. A real pleasure. Good location for shopping and access to transportation. Quaint hotel. Large rooms with first class appointments. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: chrism2112
Reviews.Content: Booked for Sonya Hotel but we were taken to Sony Suite just over the road.Accomodation was very clean and quite but bathroom was a tight squeeze and bedroom was not that big.However saying that it was adequate for a couple of days and would return to this hotel again. Continental breakfast was included in our stay which was a decent choice and enough to get you going for the day.Nice to have coffee and fruit juice freshly prepared and served to you at the table and not having to get it from a vending machine. Hotel is situated in a good location next to the opera house and within easy reach of everything and surrounding area seemd very safe.We found Cotto Restaurant on the oter side of Opera House in Via Torrono very good and prices really reasonable,well worth a try.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Affordable, Clean, central and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Tarzan_Jane029
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hotel Sonya was very enjoyable. The staff were friendly, helpful and curteous. The breakfeast was very good and the staff acommodating. The value for the stay was excellant and the ease to get to subway, train station and attractions was great. Our room was very comfortable and our stay was very pleasant. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice”
Reviews.Author: Grin X
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights. Good location, and very nice staff. Breakfast was nice (loved the cakes), though there could have been more variety. Rooms were spacious and comfortable, with an extra bed and everything. Very helpful staff, and very honest too! I forgot my bracelet in the room and they returned it with our other luggage we collected in the evening after check out! This is a good place. Stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, good location, friendly knowlegable staff”
Reviews.Author: sussexJo1962
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 6 days at Hotel Sonya and would not hesitate to recommend it. Short walk from Termini station (even with whellie bags!) , its walking distance to main attractions, but if you need to take bus, these are also very close. Quiet location, we slept with windows open. Air conditioning in rooms if you like this. Mini bar with well stocked very good priced drinks. Free internet access. Breakfast was ample, buffet style with boiled eggs, yoghurts, cereal, croissants, omlette, savory pie , assorted cake, fresh fruit, bread rolls, ham and salami in packs- what more could you ask for, oh and tea, coffee, fruit juice. Rooms cleaned daily, tea and coffee making in room. Staff directed us to appropriate bus routes, booked relevant attractions if necessary, you just need to ask. This hotel was the cheapest with the best reviews when I did my research before travelling and we were not dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sonya is terrific”
Reviews.Author: ram28
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a quiet area within walking distance of the rail station & many of the tourism sites of Rome. The personnel are all very friendly & helpful. Rooms are spacious & adequately decorated. Showers are a bit small. A plentiful breakfast is included in the very reasonable rate. Everything is kept exceptionally clean. Free internet service is available in the lobby. There are reasonably priced restaurants close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sonya - Excellent Hotel Choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: christyreznor02
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Sonya is an excellent hotel choice in Rome. The hotel is centrally located. It is a short walk from the train station and close to major sites. There are many restaurants nearby. The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and comfortable. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Room, Lame Service!”
Reviews.Author: Irishproposal
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at Hotel Sonya for three nights this past June. To begin, let me tell you about getting there from the airport. You should book a seat with their shuttle service from the airport to the hotel in advance. After we got our baggage at the Rome DaVinci Airport we then made our way to the shuttle service desk, it was closed because our flight was slightly delayed. Luckily, it opened a short time later, but check with the airport before you get there to see the hours for each airport shuttle desk, they vary depending on the terminal you arrive in. You may have to go to a different terminal for an open kiosk. The service at the hotel was pretty lame. The people working the front desk were less than friendly and didn't go out of their way to make you feel welcome. They also weren't very knowledgeable about the surrounding local attractions or restaurants to go to. We pretty much did our own research. Our room was actual very nice and pretty spacious for Rome and really modern. It was very clean as was the bathroom. No complaints in that department! The location was fantastic, walking distance to almost anywhere you wanted to go. Very safe area, we were out late every night and never felt on edge. Overall, the room and location made this hotel, I can't say the same for the service. Also, get to the breakfast first thing in the morning, everything will be picked over the later you go. If you miss breakfast don't worry, you didn't miss much. If you're an American don't order the coffee, it was horrible!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay at Hotel Sonya”
Reviews.Author: GianPaolo_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in a quite but convenient area of rome. Walking distance to many attractions. Service was great, the staff was very friendly and accommodating.Hotel staff spoke english which was also very helpful. The hotel and room itself was roomy,clean and very quaint. Hotel provides free internet. Breakfast consisted of an assortment of delicious sweets. Overall, great experience and would return to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel helpful staff 5 min from Rome Termini train station and subway”
Reviews.Author: gary2314
Reviews.Content: super location for access to all the sights in Rome. Good resturants within walking distance. Free computer use in lobby and great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location, decent stay”
Reviews.Author: Sunskiguy
Reviews.Content: I'm not a fan of Rome, but this is a quiet place to stay, clean and decent value. Paid Euro 140 double with breakfast included. Breakfast is nice, normal European style. Room had a slightly working AC unit which took some time to cool but finally did. Beds and pillows are very firm if not rock hard. Room was sort of a dull yellow -- not too cheerful but bathroom was well done, small and clean. Desk personnel were extremely friendly and internet service free of charge which was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great breakfast, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ngbngb
Reviews.Content: You couldn't ask for a better location. Close to Roma Termini, so you can get ANYWHERE in Rome on metro or bus or anywhere outside of Rome on a train. Couldn't ask for a better breakfast. If you're there on a day when the potato tart is served, you'll be happy all day. The staff is friendly and helpful and speaks and understands English (and probably other languages, but I limited my choices to English and Italian).

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sonya was a great place to stay - I'm glad we found it on TripAdvisor!”
Reviews.Author: KVic
Reviews.Content: July 2010 - We stayed at Hotel Sonya for six nights. The value was unbeatable for the location and accommodation. We paid 495Euro for six nights. I had searched TripAdvisor thoroughly while researching for a hotel and I am happy to say all of the positive reviews are genuine. You will not go wrong staying at Hotel Sonya, and if reading this review, your search should stop here. The photos on the website depicting the rooms and eating areas are accurate and not misleading at all (which after reading reviews of other hotels, can sometimes be the case). The staff was very welcoming upon arrival and showed us right up to our room, and I was pleasantly surprised to see they had accommodated my request (from months earlier) for a room with a lovely view of the Opera House. All of the staff we met during our stay were very nice and helpful. Rooms were really clean, beds were comfortable and the air conditioning was a HUGE relief to return to at the end of a scorching summer day. Continental breakfast included all you can eat: Scrambled and boiled eggs, many varieties of yogurt, buns, meat, cheese, cereal, fresh fruit, donuts, croissants, cakes, juices, coffee, cappuccino... certainly more than enough to get you going in the morning. The hotel is just a few minutes walk from both Termini station and Republic station, so the location is quite central to anything you would like to do in the Rome/Vatican City area. We felt safe walking in the area at night (actually all over Rome). The three computers in the lobby for guest use were a great perk as well (free!), so we could easily send emails and do a bit more research of places we were about to visit. You won't be disappointed if you choose to stay at this hotel. We certainly weren't.

Reviews.Title: “Easy access to train and subway”
Reviews.Author: 3girlstravels
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sonya was conveniently located within walking distance of the train and subway for good access to the rest of Rome. Ivan and the rest of the staff were helpful and friendly. Great breakfast with biggest variety of the trip. Average sized room for Europe, very clean and we felt very safe. We should have used the subway more to get around - it was super easy to navigate, which we didn't try until our last day.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location - tolle Lage & sehr gutes Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LooovesToTravel
Reviews.Content: the location could not be better! We were in the centre of Rome - everything was easily accessible by foot or bus. The staff was very friendly and accommodating! The room was clean and tidy! We had a minibar (rather small size but still), great breakfast for Italian standards, AC in the room and good housekeeping! The hotel is not located on a busy street so it was not noisy at all. This hotel is an absolute great solution for people who don’t really need a super fancy and expensive 5star hotel but don’t want to stay in a dump either. We would definitely stay her again and we recommended this hotel to our friends! BIG THANK YOU TO THE GREAT STAFF AND MANAGMENT! We will see you again! But maybe next time in spring or autumn, definitely not in the hottest summer month ;) Many thanks – Dank für den tollen Aufenthalt!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, Wonderful staff, Great location”
Reviews.Author: TryingoutTraveling
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay in Rome (July, 2010). The hotel is charmingly elegant. Located a few blocks from the Termini Station, the location couldn't be better. Our rooms were clean and comfortable. Breakfast each morning was tasty. Most importantly, the staff was outstanding. Not only were they friendly and welcoming, they went out of their way to be helpful. As sometimes happens when you least expect it, our family experienced some medical issues. The staff at the hotel helped us translate so we could make doctor appointments which allowed us to manage our time and health. We are very grateful and will recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Centrally Located Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NancyRon
Reviews.Content: After being on a cruise for 7 days, we were excited to spend 3 nights in Rome. We were looking for a small hotel near Termini (the train station) for day trips. After reading reviews on Trip Advisor we decided on Hotel Sonya. We were so pleased with absolutely everything. The rates were so reasonable and to think we were around the corner from 4 and 5 star hotels and we paid a fraction of the cost of every amenity.From the moment we arrived to the day we left, the staff couldn't do enough for us. They were friendly, gave us great advice on transportation, restaurants, and day excursions. And what a breakfast (included in the rate), wonderful coffee, cappuccinos, cereals, croissants, breads, fruits, cheese, hard boiled eggs etc. The rooms are very comfortable, clean with everything you would need including your own small computer with free wifi. The rooms are a bit small but with a great bed and wonderful shower. Our room was downstairs off the lobby and across from the breakfast room. The room next to ours would be ideal for a larger family. It has a loft, and a downstairs area with sauna, exercise equipment and bathroom. This is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel Sonya in Rome”
Reviews.Author: FunPrn
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sonya is a recently renovated (still ongoing) hotel in central Rome, only 200 yards from the main Termini train/metro station. We stayed there for four nights during a recent tour with the Rick Steves organization and found it to be the best hotel of the trip. The rooms were clean and functional, the beds and pillows were great, the bath was large and had adequate shelf space for two women and a guy and the air conditioning worked great. The staff were very helpful, especially the young man who provided drinks during breakfast. The breakfast was quite good. Given this is a six story hotel we appreciated the elevator--it only held three people at one time but it always worked! We also appreciated the high tech approach--there was a business center in reception that had three PCs with free internet access, we were able to print copies of an email list of our tour group at no charge and the hotel had great FREE WiFi access--the only hotel on the trip that provided this. We would definitely stay at Hotel Sonya on a return visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, cute place.”
Reviews.Author: myers
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel - the staff was wonderful, very helpful and pleasant. The room was clean and a nice size - the high ceilings certainly helped it feel roomy and bright. The bathroom was tight, as was the shower, but again, clean and pleasant. Quick walk to the Metro which is easy to navigate and gets you near most places. Free internet was great when booking reservations for galleries and the like. Breakfast was nothing over the top, but had plenty to choose from to get you through your morning!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Price”
Reviews.Author: terri_gott
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night in June 2010. I booked the day before and got a great rate. I was greeted warmly at check-in with fresh coffee from the new "American" coffee machine. The staff (and the owner) couldn't have been nicer. The hotel is very quaint with an old-fashioned elevator. The room was small but very clean and well equipped. The step up the bathroom as strange but the bathroom was clean and well equipped with great water pressure and ample hot water in the shower. The hotel is located on a busy street but it was very quiet in the room. This is a great value for the money. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Rome”
Reviews.Author: velvet1
Reviews.Content: We rented two rooms for three nights as we were traveling with another couple. We were given a room with an extra bed in it and our friends were given a room with a king. Rooms were adequate in size and clean. Bathrooms were clean and modern. Location near train stataion was fine. Construction was going on during the day and they shut the power off during the afternoon but it didn't really effect us because we were out and about. The breakfast was mediocre and the breakfast room was a bit small and cramped so wasn't the most enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for your money”
Reviews.Author: dolcevita_10
Reviews.Content: I took the train from Florence to Rome early this June with a reservation to stay at Hotel Sonya for two nights. Since it was the last leg of a two-week journey, I was pretty tired.Hotel Sonya is about five minutes' walk from the Termini. In fact, its proximity to the Termini was the one factor that swayed me to make the reservation (plus of course, Rick Steves' recommendation). The staff was very helpful and friendly. When I arrived at the doorsteps, a gentleman ran to help me with my luggage. It turns out that he is the owner. At the desk, I was helped by Ivan. Ivan was very friendly and helpful and he spoke very good English. He made sure I had a room available even when the room reserved for me was not ready. This meant a lot since I was dead tired from my very hectic schedule in Portugal/Spain and all the additional walking I did in Florence. When I could not get the tv to work, he came up to fix it and when I could not get the aircon to work, he came up to show me. In other words, service was quick and with a smile. Ivan also recommended a very good restaurant around the corner. Since I had only two days i n Rome, I wanted to see the sites that I missed on our first two trips to Rome. Ivan helped me with planning my itinerary. It helps a lot too that the hotel is vey close to the Metro station. This is an added bonus when you are travelling on your own in Europe. The waiter during breakfast- Jorre (I hope I am spelling his name correctly; if not, mi dispiace), was very courteous and attentive. Breakfast is free and quite good- esp. the cappucino. TO IVAN, IF YOU ARE READING THIS, GRAZIE MILLE. Melinda

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: goreybopp
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in a quadruple room for one night with my family (mom, dad, and sister). The room consisted of a double bed, plus two twin beds. While space was a little tight, we had every we needed in order to be comfortable. The free wi-fi internet was reliable and the laptop I brought from home easily connected to it. The room was clean and the hotel was easy walking distance to Termini station, where we boarded our train after checking out. Overall, the hotel represents a very good value because of the quality of the rooms, location, and helpful employees. In most cities, I usually don't like sleeping at hotels near train stations because they're usually in unsafe neighborhoods and aren't well taken care of. Hotel Sonya pleasantly surprised me, and I'd stay there again in a future visit. Our room was lovely and I felt safe walking around the vicinity with my family although we were clearly tourists. The continental breakfast was the most enjoyable part of our stay. There was much more variety than we expected so everyone had something they wanted to eat. Since we woke up early in the morning, we were able to eat in the room adjacent to the reception desk. The employees helping out with breakfast were especially friendly. The cappuccino we requested was quite tasty and we appreciated the smiley face pattern of cocoa powder sprinkled on top! (It wasn't obvious at first, but we noticed it upon closer examination.)

Reviews.Title: “Great older Hotel, nice location.”
Reviews.Author: lorihansen
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time in Rome and it was great to end the day in a nice, clean, safe, hotel that was easy to get to by metro. It was a Rick Steves recommended hotel and he did not let us down. Although older hotels in Europe tend to be small, the room was large enough for a comfortable king size bed. There was also an elevator and a complimentary breakfast the next morning. Staff was nice and spoke english. The only downside was the tiny bath/shower, but plenty of water pressure and we were only there one night. It was within easy walking distance to the train and the metro and they hailed us a cab to the airport in less than 5 minutes. It wasn't extreme luxury, but it was a great stay for the price and it had free high speed internet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: LesEastMidlands
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome for a few days relaxation after our daughter's week long wedding in Tuscany, and found the hotel a short walk from the main railway station. Check-in was simplicity itself, having pre-booked and paid in advance some months previously. We were immediately shown to the new wing, a couple of hundred yards away, by very helpful staff who spoke excellent English, and it was ideal. Rooms were adequate, if a little on the small side, but the fully stocked mini-bar proved a useful facility. Continental Breakfast was more than adequate, and was served in pleasant surroundings. Recommendations for eating out were provided for each of the 4 night stay, and we were delighted by their suggestions. One restaurant did have a 20% Service Charge, but the food, service and ambiance were very good. Free WiFi was available, as were free laptops in the room - a real bonus for pre-flight check-in and enquiries about the "Volcanic Ash Cloud!!" It might sound obvious now, but one suggestion is not to leave windows open at night - insects had a field day, and were covered in bites the following morning, but this was no fault of the hotel. The Management and staff at this hotel were most helpful, spoke excellent English, and were happy to make reservations for events, restaurants and taxis whenever they were required. We would have no hesitation in recommending the Hotel Sonya as a clean city centre hotel at a reasonable price, and will return there on our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value: Central Location”
Reviews.Author: SFT0urist
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at Hotel Sonya. It is a budget hotel so one of it's biggest appeals is the value. For those of you who are opera buffs, the hotel is right across the street from the opera house. My hotel room was small but very quiet, neat and clean. The hotel offers free wireless internet service so it was very convenient for me to email my friends at home. Breakfast is included and there is a wide selection of food. There is a small grocery store right across the street for those late-night snacks and times when you just feel like having a relaxing meal in front of the television. If you feel like going out, there are plenty of restaurants in the neighborhood. The location is very central and most tourist sites in Rome are within walking distance. The English speaking staff is very friendly and helpful. The hotel offers a shuttle service to the airport that is a lot cheaper than taking a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located with great service”
Reviews.Author: justagirl179
Reviews.Content: We only stayed 1 night as we were just passing through. The staff was very nice and helpful. The room was nice and comfortable with extra pillows and blankets already in the wardrobe. The bathroom was clean and there was plenty of hot water for showers. The breakfast was larger than some other budget hotels we have stayed at and there was a good variety of food. It's very close to the train station and there are several good restaurants within a short walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Staff excels in customer service!!”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie097
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sonja,Rome was truly a good experience for us while travelling Italy. The hotel is centrally located, within walking distance of most tourist attractions & the train station. Our room was very comfortable & clean and the bathroom a nice size. Although small & the walls thin which seems to be how it is in Italy. We did not have any trouble sleeping so it was quiet. The staff is exceptionable especially Ivan from the front desk and Farhad from the breakfast buffet which was great.You both were more than helpful. I would definitely stay there on my next trip to Rome. Ivan from the front

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded room was incredible!”
Reviews.Author: sumeet34
Reviews.Content: When we checked in, they said that we (4 of us) were being put in a new suite across the street. This was a little odd but we were in for a real treat. It was three floors with one spiral staircase. There were two flat panel TVs, comfortable beds, luxurious furnishings, a treadmill, a jacuuzi...it was incredible. It really seemed like this is the type of a room a celebrity would get and would cost several hundred euro. Instead, we paid 180 euro per night as we were quoted and loved it! There were some minor issues with the satellite TV and AC but they were resolved quickly! They also provided us with a laptop in our room and free wi-fi access! Like I said, we loved the room but not sure if this was a typical one for them. Anyway, if you get the upgrade, you will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, friendly, central location, accommodating, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Lakelady4411
Reviews.Content: My two day stay in Rome was enhanced by staying at Hotel Sonya., The staff was very friendly, helpful, and ready to lend a hand whenever needed. The morning breakfast was an extra bonus! The room was clean and close to the sights we wanted to see. The staff spoke English which helped me immensely. I recommend Hotel Sonya if you want a flavor of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location and Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: lgg14
Reviews.Content: A perfect accommodation for our short time in Rome with our group of 22. The location made for easy access to sights and restaurants. The staff was so pleasant, extremely helpful and accommodating making our stay in Rome an awesome experience.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: KBartsche
Reviews.Content: This hotel was extremely clean and comfortable. The location was great for the bus and subway. The staff was friendly and all spoke English, which was helpful since I do not speak Italian. The complementary breakfast was very good. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, comfortable hotel with excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: JKW50
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located near Termini station, and all sites within half an hour walk (Vatican a bit further). Ivan was incredibly helpful and welcoming, and we particularly noticed the friendliness and efficiency of all the staff. The room was a good size and comfortable. It's good value for money and we'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and well located !”
Reviews.Author: Cobalt06
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 6th to 9th of April. We booked a room at the Sonya Hotel but were located in their new section (at 200 meters in Via Firenze). The room was nice, very clean and quiet. We were proposed a Free Netbook and Free Internet access at our arrival. The Hotel is located centrally so that we were able to visit all major areas without using Public transportation. For those that wish to use the metro or buses, the Hotel is close to Termini station so you can use them easily. The personel is friendly and always helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Utterly Superb”
Reviews.Author: DrNom
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a fabulous small hotel in a great location to see all of Rome then book in to the Hotel Sonya. Close enough to the Main Railway terminal to walk to on arrival, it sits in a small side street opposite the Opera, with plenty of cafe's and bars nearby, in fact if you fancy sitting out side at midnight with a superb cup of English Breakfast tea and a slice of cake then turn to your left as your walk from reception and 100metres is a wonderful late night cafe. Now then, the hotel, the reception hall is a little cosy if there are a few of you. The management and staff are some of the friendliest and helpful people I have ever met, (Ivan - thanks for the loan of the netbook!). The elevator is a wonder on its own, the rooms are hidden on each floor behind huge wooden doors, open these doors and enter the corridors off which are located the rooms, The rooms are modest but comfy, with nicely appointed bathrooms, a safe, a drinks fridge and cable tv. and of course windows with shutters to open or close depending if you wish to enjoy the sweet Rome breeze... I am a breakfast man... I was not disappointed, a fab buffet, pastries, cheese, meats, yoghurt and bread, it certainly sets you up for a day wondering around the wondrous sights of Rome. go there and enjoy Dr Nom

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Rooms, Location and Service!”
Reviews.Author: BeeBe24
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights last August. The rooms were beautiful and large. The service was fantastic we booked all our tours and transfers through the hotel. The breakfast was amazing with yummy cakes and real coffee! The location was fantastic, we walked everywhere from here from Vatican City to the Colleseum to the Spanish steps and Trevi Fountain. There were some amazing restaurants within 5 minutes walk from here. Would definately reccommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sonya was perfect for our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: efiveMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The staff made our trip. They are all so kind and happy. The location is in a great neighborhood - open air market, supermarket, liquor store, many cafes, restaurants - all within one block. Metro is an easy 2 block walk. For 1 euro, we travelled quickly and easily around Rome between the Metro and Bus 64 or 40. Room was lovely, spacious & newly remodeled. Great shower! Bed was very comfy. Nice big pillows. The breakfast variety was everything you could want and more - freshly baked croissants & capucinos were my favorite part. From the service, to the location, to the free internet and breakfast. I cannot imagine a better value anywhere in Rome. Thank you Ivan, et al. for giving us such happy memories for our honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, nice staff and great location!”
Reviews.Author: alwaysItaly_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at Hotel Sonya with my family (husband and 2 kids) in August. It’s a great accommodation in the heart of Rome. The staff was very kind, helpful and friendly. We went by car and by the time of arriving to the hotel a nearby garage-parking was organized for us. We stayed in a quadruple room (325) and it was perfectly enough for 4 of us although the bathroom was a little bit small. Everything is very-very clean in the hotel!! There is an old fashioned lift in the building; we all liked it a lot. By the time we arrived to the hotel our room was very cool thanks for the very good air-condition. It was really nice to know that a cool room was waiting for us everyday at the end of a tiring and very hot sightseeing (in August it was around 35 degrees). And the beds were really comfortable, too. My husband got a free laptop to use with free internet during our stay; that was also very kind from the hotel's staff. The breakfast was just great; fresh croissants and very tasty cakes, ham, boiled eggs, cheeses, yoghurts, cereals, fresh fuits. I even got a little heart on my perfect cappuccino:) and my son drank 2 hot chocolates every morning because he liked it so much. We walked everywhere from the hotel (Vatican, the Colosseum, Spanish steps and the Trevi fountain, Pantheon, Trastevere etc.) I recommend this hotel to everyone who travels to Rome. If I go to Rome next time I will be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great central hotel with the most helpful, welcoming and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: geordieloch
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Sonya for 5nights during our recent trip to Rome for Scotland V Italy rugby match. On arrival we were promptly 'checked in' by the very friendly and efficient 'Ivan' and shown our exceptionally clean,comfortable rooms by one of the very pleasant(ever smiling) lads currently working there.There was a good selection of very fresh foods for breakfast and refreshments were served at clean well set tables by two more friendly pleasant young men. Ivan as well as the other two very friendly helpful reception staff assisted us track down out luggage which had gone missing in transit. Maid service was excellent and clean towels provided everyday.Great base for sightseeing in Rome

Reviews.Title: “A perfect base for sightseeing in Rome”
Reviews.Author: MossyT
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights at this hotel with my partner and baby daughter. I couldn't recommend this hotel enough....great value for money, perfect location and excellent staff. Everyone from the receptionist to the breakfast waiters were top class. 3 nights isn't enough time to see everything in Rome, so I will return, and when I do, I will definitely book in the Hotel Sonya again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location very clean and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: sophienorthumberland
Reviews.Content: stayed in the hotel opera rome the sister hotel, very clean excellent location and very friendly staff. only 10 mins walk from termini great for airport bus 6 euros. nice selection of restuarants nearby. Great place for exploring all the sights very central. would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: tharsdim
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, Excellent Location, Very friendly staff.... If we visit Rome again, it is in Sonya that we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Sophisticated Comfort”
Reviews.Author: Chaptall
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Sonya was centrally located for us to walk or use the public transportation to get around most of Rome. Our room was recently renovated, looked and felt comfortable for our stay. The staff, in the office, the breakfast room and the cleaning staff were most welcoming and willing to help us. The breakfast staff was especially friendly; we enjoyed their conversation. If the occasion arises I would book this Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Sonya is one of the best choises of Rome...”
Reviews.Author: guest_56Athens
Reviews.Content: it's a very clear hotel with cooperative and friendly staff...the location of the hotel helps a lot if you don't hire a car.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: ChrisC27
Reviews.Content: Probably should be 3 1/2 stars. Like almost all the hotels in Europe the rooms are tiny, so you can pretty much expect that anywhere you go. The staff was definitely 5 star, they were friendly, attentive and spoke english. However, we stayed there a while ago, so this may have changed. We were surprised to see that the building isn't just a hotel, the rooms on the sides of ours on the 2nd floor had actual residents. Nothing bothersome, just not used to that. The room was clean, bathroom was fine, but no frills for the rooms really. We had 4 people so there was a double bed a single and I was pretty much given a glorified cot. But it wasn't too bad, and I couldn't really complain, had no trouble falling asleep. The room was quiet and even though we were facing the street there was hardly any street noise at all. The continental breakfasts weren't anything to write home about, but they do still outshine any continental breakfast I've ever had in the US by far. Cappuccino was very good, as were the fresh croissants, deli meats and cheeses. There were other options, rolls, hard boiled eggs etc, and is serve yourself except for the coffee/juice. Internet access was free, but just one computer by the check in desk. The elevator is tiny, and I can't emphasize that enough. One or two people and maybe your luggage will fit. But the stairs weren't that bad. The area is fine, didn't have a worry and felt ok walking around, even at night. It is within 15 minutes walking distance of the Trevi fountain and the Spanish steps. Colosseum was only 20 minutes. It is also right across the street from the Opera house and the train station is only a 10 minute walk. If I were staying in Termini I wouldn't have a problem staying there again. But if you're looking for a big time hotel experience, with lavish decorations, big rooms and amenities, then you're gonna have to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: msctt68
Reviews.Content: Really friendly staff, well located to access the major sites of Rome. The room was very clean. Air conditioning, fridge and safe at no extra cost. Continental style breakfast was excellent with good choice of croissant, cakes, fruit, yogurt and cereal. Handy for buses and trains.

Reviews.Title: “exellent!!”
Reviews.Author: cheshireElle
Reviews.Content: we had 5 days in Rome and the whole experience was amazing. This hotel is exellently located, even though we used the metro one day - which was very convenient and cheap, the rest of the time we walked and found this no problem, the hotel is in resonable reach of everywhere. The rooms are warm, comfortable and clean, breakfast is good. ok no english breaky - but you are in rome!!!, the staff are very friendly and extremely helpful - nothing was too much trouble. The lift is an experience in its self - we loved it - it all adds to the feel of italy! Overall an exellent little hotel - i would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: RenMar1
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on line direct with the hotel for 6 nights. When we arrived too early they took care of our luggage so we could start exploring around Rome. Rooms were very clean and roomy and looked like they were renovated not too long ago. Breakfast was good with very friendly staff, service realy good and the location is close to all the sites. All in all we enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend this hotel. Excellent value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: CoegoPlus
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my mum (65) and my untie (55) and they love it. It has easy access to buses and metro. My mum loved the lift/elevator. It was safe and we got a security box on our rooms. You can control the air conditioner and heating on the room. A nice windows has both blind and curtains. We got new towels every day and internet access. Breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: mmill527
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about a 5 minute walk from Termini Train station and is a nice area of Rome. 2-3 minute walk to the metro (subway) at Piazza Republica makes getting to all areas of Rome very easy, or if you are in fair shape you can walk to main sites from hotel. We stayed for 4 nights, went to the Amalfi Coast, and came back for 2 more nights. The staff held our big luggage while we were gone so we didn't have to carry it all on the train / bus ride to Amalfi. Both rooms were very clean, breakfast was good, and the staff was friendly and very helfpul. Excellent hotel for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: guanabo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great choice for us. We had a comfortable room, in a great location for sightseeing (close to Termini Station (trains) and Cinquecento, the bus station) and a helpful and accommodating staff. In addition to all that, I thought their breakfast (which was included) was better than most other hotels we visited during our Italy trip. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sonya worked for us as seniors from California, USA”
Reviews.Author: airplaneguy888
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights starting 10/5/09 in Room 445, pre-cruise. Rome Cabs provided transfer from FCO for 45 Euro (highly recommended). Our reservation and room request were honored as agreed. We arrived early so our luggage was stored in a secure room and we strolled around Rome until check in at 1:30 pm. English is spoken well and Mr. Babul, Ivan and Joy (male) provided outstanding service as did the breakfast room staff. Though small by American standards the room was spotless and accommodated our needs very well. We found the bed and pillows too firm (hard!), a small complaint. The room was cleaned and fresh towels provided daily. All amenities claimed were provided, including AC which worked well. The lift is old, quaint and great fun actually. Breakfast was quite good with a variety of pastries, including cereal with low fat milk if desired and adequate Americano coffee. It suited our needs. We selected Hotel Sonya based on this site’s reviews and its location, an easy walk to Rome Termini where all forms of transportation is available. We used the Green Line open deck bus primarily. Around the corner at Via Nappoli 4 is Antian Boheme, great menu, fairly priced and excellent service. Ask for a jug of the house red wine. 8 Euro worth serves four nicely, a good value. Straight out of the hotel entrance walk a long block on Via Firenze to Via Nazionale where Byron’s is located. It is very casual, inexpensive, adequate menu and offers an excellent house Chianti. The hotel location proved to be safe and quiet enough though I will admit the general pace of life and traffic in Rome drove me crazy (getting too old perhaps). All said, we would stay again and booked friends in for a short pre-cruise stay. They would agree with the above.

Reviews.Title: “an ideal base for visit to Rome, friendly staff, clean and comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: joandun
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sonya is ideally placed if you want to see rome on foot. Non of the major attractions are too far away. We walked to the vatican .took about 45mins.Collosseum about 20mins from hotel. Nice quiet location at night, no traffic noise. room was very clean and comfortable. staff were friendly and helpful. ate in local restaurants. just around corner from hotel on via napoli a restaurant called Antica Boheme. fantastic food at good value. lovely staff. we paid a retun visit.La Matriciana , just a few doors up from hotel , lovely food,a little more pricey but worth it.We also ate in Est Est Est, pizzaria on via Genova, very dissapointing, even though it was reccommended in AA guide book.Although we complained about quality of food staff were very dismissive.wont go back there!.took combined tour of Colosseum and Palatine hill, which seemed expensive at €28 per person, but in fact was worth it. Was warm in rome for october, 27degrees. We noticed that a lot of tourists were filling their water bottles from the street drinking fountains.We tried it and came to no harm!. Sistine chapel smaller and darker than I imagined.Overall rome was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and walking distance to Termini station”
Reviews.Author: taurus8
Reviews.Content: We sifted through many trip advisor reviews to choose a hotel for our 4 night stay in Rome. We wanted to be close to the Termini station as we were arriving and departing by train and finally chose the Hotel Sonya based on all the favourable comments and the reasonable room rates. It was an easy 5 -10 minute walk from station. Upon arrival any concerns about staying near Termini were soon dispelled. The staff gave us a very warm welcome, even took our heavy luggage to our room for us! The room was lovely, very clean, and very comfortable . Bathroom small but well appointed. Small problem with our bathroom door was very quickly attended to by hotel staff who were all friendly and jovial, and all spoke English well. Breakfast was one of the best we had in Italy during our 5 week stay. Great hot coffee too! Free internet access was fast and reliable.
