The other thing that surprised us was how close we were to major tourist attractions and the metro stop. Colosseum was an easy 15 minute walk away! Starting point for the hop-on-hop-off bus is only a few short blocks away too and is good way to familiarise yourself with central Rome. There are also plenty of good dining options nearby. Had very good meals at Gallina Bianca and "That's Amore" This was a very good hotel and we would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would use again”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghEmilie
Reviews.Content: My partner and I made our first trip to Rome last month and he spent hours reviewing comments on all types of hotels before he chose Hotel Sonya. The location was ideal as it was a 5 minute walk from Stazione Terminie. We were advised we had been placed in a section down the street which was in fact Hotel Opera Roma. At first we were a bit weary as per one of the other reviews. The rooms were recently done up and of good quality. The bathroom was nice, air con and a safe to use. The only niggle was the bed was a bit stiff. The staff were excellent and all too welcoming. The breakfast was good, kept in the local tradition. An ideal place to hang your hat while making a city break. We'd be happy to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location close to Termini Station plus very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: gerritrekkers
Reviews.Content: We chose a hotel close to the Termini station and hotel Sonja was within 5 mintues. The staff were really pleaseant and helpful and informed us which was the best laundrette to go to. The room was clean and air conditioned as Rome in August was very very hot. The room was a decent size with a smallish bathroom but adequate for our needs as we only used the hotel as a base and was mostly out sightseeing. The rooms were cleaned and towels changed daily. We were really really pleased with this hotel and would gladly stay again. We would also recommend to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff and breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Jeanandtom
Reviews.Content: We searched for a moderately priced hotel close to transportation. We found a great spot at Hotel Sonya. It was a quick walk from both Termini Station (trains) and Cinquecento (buses). The staff were very accommodating and helpful and the breakfast was the nicest we got at any hotel during our 2 week vacation to Italy. The rooms are smaller than US residents may be used to but certainly adequate. Free internet access was readily available. There is an elevator which is not always available in many other hotels! The shower stall was small but had GREAT water pressure so you got a really good shower! We would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family and we will visit again when we can.

Reviews.Title: “surprisngly nice and reasonbly priced in Rome”
Reviews.Author: smiling_everywhere
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in Rome on the way elsewhere. I was pleasantly surprised by everything about it. All I needed was a clean, safe, and reasonably-priced place not too far from the train station, but this is a place I would even stay for longer than that. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, and the free internet and printing facilities in the lobby made it even more convenient. The rooms were basic, but nicer than they had to be and seemed to have been recently renovated. good pressure in the shower too. This is not a fabulous honeymoon place or anything like that, but being in Rome isn't about your room anyway, and this was a clean, comfortable, convenient, and safe place to sleep in a city that is full of more expensive places that offer none of that.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: seeyahale
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Quad room on the 4th floor for 3 nights in late July. Whilst it was a little squeezy we didn't spend a great deal of time in our rooms anyway (why would you when there is so much to see in Rome). The bathroom was modern, clean and did it's job and the beds we found comfortable. The reception is on the ground floor and the rooms are accessed via a really quaint, old fashioned lift (or you can take the stairs of course). Breakfast was plentiful with the usual continental items and they will make your coffee according to your taste. Very convenient to all the sights, the Termini train station and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A good little spot!”
Reviews.Author: WantMoreHolidays
Reviews.Content: A basic hotel which serves its purpose well!!! Hotel Sonya is a short walk from Termini station, about 5 - 10 minutes. Easy to reach all the sights. Free internet access was good! Staff were very helpful and friendly! Good security too. Photo on website is misleading, as it is the opera house not the hotel, so it caused us some confusion! Overall, happy with the hotel and it's reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Excellent room”
Reviews.Author: Scubamom33
Reviews.Content: Our family of four, including two boys ages 12 and 15, stayed two nights at the Hotel Sonya in late June. The staff were friendly and accommodating - our mini fridge did not seem to work properly and we needed it to keep some medication cool - they promptly had someone come and deal with the problem. The breakfast they provided was hearty and kept our two sons satisfied and we foudn the overall location an excellent place to be based from. In fact, we walked everywhere from the hotel...St Peters, the Colosseum, Spanish steps and the Trevi fountain. Beds were a bit hard but that seems to be par for the course in any European hotel. overall we were happy with the Hotel Sonya and our sons were happy that they did not have to share a bed in the Quad room!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GandS81
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on others recommendations. The location close to the Termini and walking distance of attractions is excellent as is the breakfast (continental). Yes the rooms are small but they have comfortable beds, great bathroom and are spotlessly clean. The price is also good value for Rome. The free internet connection was also great. The best thing however is the staff who speak excellent English and are amazingly helpful (especially Babul). We stayed twice and would not consider staying anywhere else even if our budget was larger.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: raybsuk
Reviews.Content: Well appointed room and facilities. Very comfortable stay.Breakfast, Mini bar, Tea making facilities and safety deposit box included in room rate. Thought this was good value for money. Roma termini only 10 minutes walk away for connection to Terravision bus to Campino airport and train connections to other major termini. Lots of restraunts close at hand and also supermarket across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Goed hotel”
Reviews.Author: Poeminho
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, cozy double room, small bathroom but very nice. Breakfast was good but come early. Helpfull staff. HOtel is good situated. We where there in februari, so good price/quality.

Reviews.Title: “Good location,safe,clean, staff very helpful,very promptly response,especially Ivan who is very helpful and hospitality.”
Reviews.Author: Ivymuicoffee
Reviews.Content: Good location. Good service. Breafast is nice. Can use the internet at lobby or wi-fi at room. Everywhere u want to go, just ask the staff who is very helpful. Even Ivan bring u to room. All are very great,just one is not quite good for shower space is limited. Near hotel is one good reasturant and price is reasonable and very yummy for pizza,fried pumpkin flower ,pasta and dessert. Called "Est Est Est" and Monday is off. Little street via genora and the resturant is the LAST on the left(opposite chinese resturant)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: homeagainPhila
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The air conditiong was on when we arrived and it was wonderful to walk into a cool room. The hotel has a set of marble steps around an old fashioned elevator which was charming. It worked smoothly and we never had to wait for it. We liked everything about this hotel, the room, bath, service was all great. It even provided a hair dryer. We heard horror stories about other hotels from people we met on tours and we were so thankful to be at the Hotel Sonya.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, accomodations and ammenities”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Fan_120207
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sonya was chosen from Rick Steve's 'Italy 2009'. We stayed here upon return to Rome for 1 night before departing Italy. The hotel was everything and more than Rick Steves described. First, the location was within comfortable walking distance from the train station. Second, the hotel staff were friendly and accomodating upon arrival. Third, the rooms were spacious and the bathrooms were the most luxurious we had while in Italy. I wish we had stayed here upon arrival. We had airconditioning, TV, free internet access, excellent continental breakfast along with a comfortable, quiet sleep. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone traveling for either a short or long stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very Accommodating!!”
Reviews.Author: Explore09
Reviews.Content: Hotel was not too grand in appearance. But there were very accommodating!! I got there 10am and check in wasn't until 1pm..They get me a room within a hour which I was very thankful for due to having a long flight. It's close to the train station and sight seeing tours. The rooms and elevator is small, but very nice and clean. I would definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location. Small but very friendly ;)”
Reviews.Author: valkirius
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located - in walk distance from Railway Station, close to the centre. Small but very comfortable rooms, nice look at Via del Viminale, old fashioned lift ;). Very helpfull service. Breakfast rooms very small but compansated very tasty breakfasts and delicious cakes.

Reviews.Title: “great service and super breakfast”
Reviews.Author: suejack100
Reviews.Content: Booked two rooms here for myself, mum ,sister and neice for 4 nights . Very close to Termini and shuttle bus from airport. Well looked after at breakfast by lovely staff. Lots of fresh cakes and croissants every day. Quirky old fashioned lift. Room small but adequate on 5th floor. A visit to remember. Will return with my husband

Reviews.Title: “Not people friendly”
Reviews.Author: patraveler48
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay, but we had contacted them prior to trip to make sure they had hair dryers. The hair dryer was one that you had to hold down the button the whole time you dried your hair. I t was to save money. Also, it would be good if they had a few places that thy could recommend for people to eat. Most people don't have a clue and a few suggestion would be helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The bed really let it down”
Reviews.Author: MarysiaRTW
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the great reviews. Hotel seems clean (although there is a very faint smell of sewerage in the room which would bely the fact - not sure if this is from the street or the room) and rooms have been recently refurbished. For Rome this is a quiet location and it's walking distance to transport and all the sights. Sadly.... There is a plastic sheet on the mattress! I probably had the most uncomfortable night's sleep in Italy so far. Spoiled my one day stop over in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great service”
Reviews.Author: Liselotte69
Reviews.Content: Really friendly hotel with a fabulous breakfast. Could recommend this hotel to families with children and to anyone who wish to stay close to major sights in Rome. Clean and spacious rooms. I loved every minute of my hotel stay and liked the surrounding areas, very quite and lovely. I would defenitely stay here next time I go to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Successful travel to Rome”
Reviews.Author: I2009
Reviews.Content: Went to Rome in the end of February, 2009 (5 nights), for the first time having organised all trip independently. Weather was good, but little bit cool. In the afternoon the temperature of air from 7 to 15 degrees, in the first days fell to-1 so it was necessary to put on a beret and gloves in the evening. The rain was once, went hour 2. Hotel has chosen too independently on responses on http://www.tripadvisor.com. The hotel has liked, all corresponded to responses (if, as always, to reject extreme opinions). It occupies a part of a usual apartment house in the centre of Rome, on each ladder platform of each floor 3 sound wooden doors: directly opposite to an exit from the lift an input in a hotel corridor from which there are doors to numbers, and to the right and on the left doors of apartments in which there live the Roman citizens (see the photo). The system of electronic keys Everywhere works-at an input from a ladder, at an input in number. Advantages, important for me: 1. An excellent arrangement: in 200 metres from via Nazionale (used buses much) and in 500 metres from Termini (was going to go for one day to Florence). 2. Pure silent number (5 floor) in which there is a table, a minibar, a case, the TV, the safe, a teapot and tea-coffee-sugar, the conditioner (which I periodically included on heating). The window left directly on opera theatre-beauty. A bathroom with a per capita cabin which in the sizes is quite convenient, a dryer for towels and with all necessary [--] which worked. Towels changed every day. 3. Good sound insulation if only neighbours did not rustle in a corridor about my door. And when all were in numbers-silences. Only, sometimes someone silently played music behind a wall, probably, the neighbour-Roman. It was very lovely! 4. A breakfast: flakes of 2 kinds, yoghurt (tasty), sausage , cheese (triangles in a foil), oil (it was not pleasant to me, has bought and ate the). Batches - my favourite pie with spinach (the dough as for a pizza) - super! Any fruitcakes and pies (2-3 kinds), croissants, simple rolls (1 kind), all fresh, warm. Fruit-oranges, apples, bananas. Juice. And at last, the waiter brings coffee - by request. Cappuchino it is very good, once tried chocolate, too it is tasty. 5. In a hall always in an easy approach 3 computers with Internet connection. 6. Since I do not know English, and I speak in French a little, for me it was important, that one of employees on reception spoke in French. 7. The kind personnel though no problems at me existing and to check up them in a stressful situation it was not necessary, and thank God! 8. Presence shuttle the airport-hotel and hotel-airport at the price of 14 euros (in one party). Lacks, for me not having special value: 1. A room and a bathroom small on the area. 2. A floor everywhere stone, that is good, probably, in a heat. And when the temperature and reaches in the evening to-1 it is cold at night. So take warm socks.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel with very attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: shopaholicScotland
Reviews.Content: stayed at the Hotel Sonya from 24th February for 4 nights. We had a very good sized room (with three beds) kettle, with tea , coffee and sugar, (milk was in the mini bar firdge) safe in wardrobe, and a big bathroom with shower. A big bonus was the huge bath sheet. Breakfast was delicious, fresh fruit, yogurt, rolls, cereal, ham, cheese, jams or chocolate spread, and finally cakes. All the staff we met at Hotel Sonya could not have been more attentive. Would love to come back again.

Reviews.Title: “great no frills clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: aoc
Reviews.Content: hello. we stayed here for a few nights and were thrilled with our choice. i had done a lot of research and got a great deal on the hotel's web page. i paid 102e for 2 nights b&b here for both of us. the hotel was fairly easy to find and only 10min walk from termini. its about 5mins walk from piazza republica for the hop on hop off buses and only 15min to piazza venezia or colliseum or trevi fountain. the room was spotless, bed and pillow were extremely comfortable. our room was at the front and opened onto a view of the opera house. breakfast was the usual pastries, cheese, ham and lovely cappucino all served in lovely small cozy dining areas. staff were friendly and helpful. i would definately stay here again and would recommend it to anyone. we found an absolutely faboulas pizza restaurant just of via nazionale. you can get onto this street by going down one of the side street oposite hotel sonya. turn left and keep going down, past eurostars hotel on left. there is a little street called via genova and the restaurant is the LAST on the left. try it, its amazing. also on via nazionale is a cute little church where we say the excellent la traviata. if you get to go there, do. its a real treat. on rome - i could never never put into words what this city did for me. it is so amazing and nothing prepared us for its beauty and history. places like the forum, palatine hill, capitoline area, panteon, colliseum or largo di torre argentine just took our breath away. we were so overcome at times - thank you rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean and Cute and Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: reconciled
Reviews.Content: We've stayed with many hotels around the world from budget to 5 star world class hotels and for us cleanliness was one of the most important. And we would give it a 5/5 for cleanliness. We also enjoyed the very cute cozy self-serve breakfast with coffee and capucinno service. My only problem I had was that the smell of cigarette would seep into the rooms when we opened the windows to get some air because the staff were just outside the building smoking whenever they can. And it's a pretty small room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Lovely Staff”
Reviews.Author: MvG_NL
Reviews.Content: My son and I visited Rome and stayed at Hotel Sonya over the Christmas holiday. It is perfectly located, really central. We walked everywhere from the hotel; the Colosseum, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and the Forum. We even walked to the Vatican which was only 45 minutes. The room was clean and spacious and the breakfast was very nice. But the best part was their lovely personnel, they were very friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just loved it”
Reviews.Author: HeidiN
Reviews.Content: Everything was great in this hotel. Staff was very friendly and helpfull and breakfeast was good. We had to stay in two different rooms because the hotel was over booked and rooms were both very nice and comfortable. And the location was execellent. Only 10 minutes to Colosseum by walking and good shopping streets were just minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay at Hotel Sonya!!!”
Reviews.Author: FF15
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, we had a twin room- went with my sis for short break. we had one of the newly reburbished rooms on 4th floor- really lovely. Very nicely designed- modern and very clean. the staff were really lovely and helpful, breakfast every morning had a good choice of food. Location was very close to Termini Station, where we got dropped off and picked up from and as we had an early morning flight back home this was really good. Also close to underground transport to get around. There is a beautiful old lift that takes you up to the floor- about 150 years old apparently!

Reviews.Title: “Pure and clean”
Reviews.Author: LuisBaptista
Reviews.Content: We have just return from Hotel Sonya (3 nights), and it was a great experience. They put us in their new and renovate Sonya Suite which are better then the tradicional Hotel Sonya, so ask because is preferable this new hotel across the street. The Hotel was renovate, everything smiles like new, the bathroom has powerful water easily hot, and in the bedroom very good mattress, and something for me very important: no light through the windows during the morning because the curtains are efficient. But, bedroom are not large. The brekfast has quality, with the normal things. Also important the free internet in the reception. Less positive is the fact they don´t have a room for the guests, but just a small reception. The personal OK.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near the National Museum”
Reviews.Author: drillerdoc
Reviews.Content: The third and last hotel of our Rick Steves' tour, within walking distance to bus and metro stops, as well as the National Museum and the Baths of Diocletian. Very clean rooms with a refrigerator and TV, but a very small and tight bathroom and small shower. The bed was comfortable and the room was quiet. The elevator is slow and a little shaky by US standards, but you will want to use it if you are on the upper floors. The hotel offers free internet and computers which was a real treat after a week without checking your e-mail. The breakfast was great with a wide variety of pastries, fruit and cold cuts.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best, but not bad”
Reviews.Author: slowtraveller0057
Reviews.Content: Comfortable hotel. Good location. I'm not sure if we'd stay there again, but the value was good.

Reviews.Title: “The Sonya Suites debacle”
Reviews.Author: Lisa C
Reviews.Content: This was a strange experience. We were a group of 7 and we had booked this hotel a few months in advance. When we arrived in Rome, and then at the hotel, they had no record of us. They said our reservation was at a hotel down the street and not at Sonya Suites as they did not have the rooms to accomodate us. We were very disappointed and realized that this huge building (featured in the photo of the hotel) is not actually the hotel. They are a little grotto in that building with only a few rooms. We went to this other hotel and were horrified at what we saw. The rooms were seedy to say the least and the floors were shared with people actually living there. Cigarette butts on the stairwell. We were so creeped out. You know the kind of room that you think you might catch something from. You know those hotels that you walk past that are just a doorway on the street, and they look so nasty even from the sidewalk. Well, this is where we were sent. We were hungry and sick of fighting with the front desk, and ate at a bistro that was next to the Mondial (Best Western) and my sister went in to that hotel and asked about rooms. They had rooms so she booked them and after lunch we went back to the other hotel and left. They were not happy as they wanted to charge us but we said that if they push this then we will call the police as we had been deceived by Sonya Suites. This hotel had also said that they had a good rating from Tripadvisor. That was so hard to believe. We left this hotel and never looked back. The Mondial was such an improvement even though my son and I had the misfortune to hear the next room fornicating. Way too much information for a mother and son. The walls there were paper thin, but such a step up from the other place. When I find out what the hotel name was that we thought was Sonya Suites, I will update this review. Be very careful when booking at the Sonya Suites and don't be decieved by the photo that is featured in their ad. They are in this building but in a grotto.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, tiny”
Reviews.Author: kindredspirits
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at Hotel Sonya and it was very nice. The beds were very comfy and although small by American standards, was by far not our smallest room. We primarily picked it for it's promixity near the train station. Never having been there, we were a bit anxious about the area, as we had read mixed reports as to how safe it is near there. We felt totally secure traveling from the Hotel to and from the Termini. And we discovered that the Metro station is also in the Termini, a nice bonus and very convienent. The breakfast there was the best of all the breakfasts we enjoyed on our 18 day trip. Large selection of breads, pastries, cereal, fruit, juices, coffee, etc. Like most things in Rome, it was an old building, but has been updated, everything except for the elevator. It could only carry 2 people and their bags and was totally open. Very neat feature. We also enjoyed the free internet in the lobby. The front desk was very helpful with check in, holding our bags on our check out day, giving directions and offering great suggestions such as directing us to a local market that was only open on Sunday. We paid $140E per night, which you may find a bit cheaper somewhere else, but it did provide the service and met the standards that we would expect from that price range which is always nice. When we originally looked around to book a room we found Rome to be our most expensive venue, but wanted peace of mind transiting to and from the Termini and this fit our desires perfectly. There are other hotels nearby, so you may find a litte less expensive, but if you are not sure and want a sure bet then I recommend Hotel Sonya. I can easily see us staying there again. I strongly do not recommend eating at the nearby restaurants, they get the distinction of serving our 2 worst meals of our entire trip. (How can you screw up pasta?) So, if you are planning a trip to Rome, and want to find a good place near the Termini, you won't go wrong with Hotel Sonya.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: shnook72
Reviews.Content: Clean and centrally located but TINY rooms.

Reviews.Title: “What a great first expereince...”
Reviews.Author: mnegron67
Reviews.Content: I have to say that for my first time overseas I was pleasantly surprised with the Hotel. It was very cute and the staff at both hotels were extremely nice. The hotel was easy to find from the the train station and public transportation was easy to get to from the hotel. I was fortunate enough to be there right before the theater opened so I was able to hear them practice during the early evening hours. I booked my first night by contacting the hotel via e-mail and then stayed for several more nights with a tour group. They had a very nice breakfast each morning - loved the coffee!! I went from a single room to the suite with the tour group and that was a very pleasant surprise. You can check your e-mails in the lobby area and the market is close by to pick up snacks. There is also a location down the street to make phone calls overseas if necessary.

Reviews.Title: “What More Can You Ask ...”
Reviews.Author: SoonersOklahoma
Reviews.Content: ...of a hotel in the middle of Rome at a reasonable price? Hotel Sonya had it during a 5-day visit with my wife... - helpful, friendly staff - good location - nice-sized rooms - cleanliness - free internet access - good breakfasts - safe area, easy to find - good restaurants, eateries and amenities nearby - reasonable price - chocolates on the pillow at night? Nah, they didn't have it. But the staff was so nice, we were bringing them chocolates. Great value for us during our stay. (Obviously we had a good visit to Rome and Sonya had a lot to do with it.)

Reviews.Title: “Roma Roma...”
Reviews.Author: SweetPeaAdventures
Reviews.Content: I booked directly through the hotel website and it was very easy and straight forward. It was within walking distance from the train station. A bit of a hike to all the "must see's" in Rome, but for the $$ it was worth the extra walk. The hotel was clean, safe, and the staff were friendly. We spent 3 full days in Rome and still did not have enough time to see everything. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Denver007Traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night due to its proximity to Termini (5 minute walk). When we first arrived, we were concerned because they told us we were going to be staying in a different building. We had no reason to worry -- our room was newly renovated, and was only located a half block away from the main hotel. Although small, the room was newly renovated and had a very comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Good value at the Hotel Sonya”
Reviews.Author: angderby
Reviews.Content: Good position 5 minutes from metro. Decent sized room - very well furnished and first class shower room. Excellent room service - very clean. Quite noisy at back of hotel but quiet at the front. Good continental breakfast and again very attentive staff. Good reception staff who booked tickets and taxis efficiently. Overall, excellent value for money for a three star hotel in an expensive city. Would recommend and revisit. A & T Davey, Derby, England

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Budget Hotel For Families in Rome”
Reviews.Author: masewell
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell - A budget Hotel geared towards Americans(especially families). Slept five for 100 Euro - incl breakfast. Amazing price for Rome. Room was small as was bathroom. Shower was small too. But as we were just there for weekend most of our time was not spent in the room. Breakfast room was a bit busy and was a continental spread - (they bring you coffee/juice) . Location wise - 5-7 min walk from Termini Station. Walked about 15-20 mins to Trevi. This is right across the street from the Opera house. There is a liquor store immediately next door where you can buy wine and a small grocery store across the street. If I was travelling to rome with five people and on a budget - this would be at the top of the list for me.

Reviews.Title: “A Slap in the Face”
Reviews.Author: helgaLima
Reviews.Content: One of our bags was stolen from us in the lobby of this hotel during our check-in process as our attention was diverted in order to sign our documents for the staff. They did not appear to care about the situation when we realized we were missing one bag. We know we had the bag upon check-in because our passports were in there and we had just removed them for the staff to copy. These terrible people wouldn't even tell us how to get to the police station so that we could file a report. They claimed that their security cameras were not functional and that they did not see anyone take our bag. Luckily, our passports were in our hands but unfortunately several cameras worth well over one thousand dollars, our pre-paid train tickets and a recently purchased engagement ring to be presented on this trip were in this very special bag. It was a small carry-on. We finally made it to the police station on our own with little sleep and heavy hearts. We were told not to worry, we filed a report and were reassured that professional establishments carried insurance for this very purpose. We were persistent for staff follow-through of the situation throughout our short stay at this hotel and attempted communication during the rest of our stay in Italy and even for months back in the U.S. to no avail. They refused to help us in any way. They were truly seedy and ultimately suspicious considering their lack of professionalism and unwillingness to assist us. They patronized our efforts and practically laughed at our loss. We mangaged to have a brilliant Italian experience dispite this hell hole but we are surely more cautious with our hotel bookings and our belongings, especially during check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy Hotel Sonya”
Reviews.Author: victa65
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three days in October. Actually, my room was in their annexe, Sonya Suites, 100m down via Firenze beside the Opera House. The hotel clerk carried my suitcase and escorted me to the building and up to my room. It was a lovely, clean, decent sized room (by European standards) and was air-conditioned. The bathroom was well appointed and very clean. It also included a bidet. Now, being non-European, I`ve never used a bidet and don`t see the need to have one in a bathroom. It was actually very awkward to get in and out of the shower with the bidet there. A bidet is obviously a European affectation that I just don`t understand. My breakfast room was on the ground floor of the Sonya Suites. The fare was plentiful and delicious and the staff were very polite and attentive. I often had lunch and dinner at the restaurant 50m down via Firenze – Ristorante Esperia. It had great food and service. The main hotel reception on via del Viminale had free internet access for guests which was great for me as I hadn`t been able to access my emails for some time. The location was brilliant. The Repubblica metro station was 2 blocks away. As was the Palazzo Massimo Alle Terme, a very impressive museum. Roma Termini was probably only 800m away. The Sonya Suites are beside the Opera House down via Firenze and on my first evening, when I opened my window, I could hear the divas practising their singing. Too cool. The staff spoke English and were always helpful. They also have an airport shuttle service for a reasonable fee. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “great compact hotel”
Reviews.Author: patu
Reviews.Content: Great compact hotel, breakfast good even though the breakfast room is a bit tight for room at the height of the rush hour! The room was nicely put together, tiny, but good local views from hotel bedroom window of the market and foot traffic.The bathroom would not do for persons who are very larger as they wouldn't fit in the shower!!!!!!!!! Good local restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: nunovieira
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 5 night in November ( Rome gets really cold by this time of the year) got a great promotion on their website: 90 euros for a triple room, breakfast buffet included the room was good, spacious, comfortable beds the bathroom was ok , but small by "american standards" good heating, the rooms were always warm the staff was professional and very nice great breakfast buffet, the breakfast room is small but cosy, only once did I need to wait for a free table the location is ok, near Temini station ( 5 minutes walk) but not in a dodgy area, in fact the Minister of Interior is just across the street overall, I was very pleased with the stay, I think I got a great deal ( 90 euros/triple room), though if I ever return to Rome I will probably try a location in the historic centre

Reviews.Title: “thrown to the wolves”
Reviews.Author: HouTrav
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to my stay at Hotel Sonya after reading all the good reviews. However, my experience began with a rude receptionist clerk who was on a personal phone call when I arrived. I waited patiently but he was clearly annoyed that he had to give up his call to attend to me. I was told that the shower had broke in my room and the hotel was full with a Rick Steves tour group. He indicated I was being put in another hotel down the street (Hotel Repubblica). I was promptly escorted 2 blocks away and unknown to me until after checking in and seeing the room, that this place was a major dump (see reviews for this hotel). I feel that I should have been accomodated better, but since I was only a one night reservation, I was not important. What I learned is, that I can't count on Hotel Sonya to have my room reservation and will be staying elsewhere when returning to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent price, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Galena11
Reviews.Content: We booked eight nights with Hotel Sonya because wanted a decently-priced (120 Euro) three-star hotel that was close to Termini Station. Overall, we would go back to stay. Best Points: * Hotel Sonya is an easy ten-minute (maximum) walk from Termini Station and its Metro and bus hubs. It is ideally situated for walking or taking public transit to any of Rome's most popular sights or for day trips via train to other Italian cities. * Staff was always friendly, spoke basic English, and immediately accommodated our requests to change rooms (see below) and reserve places on the airport shuttle. * Rooms are very clean and nicely appointed with air conditioning, in-room safe, mini bar, hair dryer, and double-paned glass and window shutters to minimize street noise. * Breakfast--standard continental fare served buffet style--included delicious cappuccino and espresso and can be delivered to your room for a small fee. * There are three computers with free Internet access in the lobby. Be Aware That: * Room size is variable. Our first room was very small even by European standards (my 6'2" husband got claustrophobic), but our second was nearly American-sized. * The area, while safe, is quite "touristy". * At the time of our visit (early October 2007), both the street and the opera house were undergoing construction; the noise was noticeable even with the windows closed. * There is a grocery store across the street where we bought snacks and beverages for far less than the 2 Euro drinks in the mini bar. There are a pharmacy, wine shop, and gelateria in the immediate area, as well as a couple of very good restaurants (we loved Ristorante Strega and a nearby deli/wine shop that stayed open until 2 AM).

Reviews.Title: “Small room, but would recommend anyway”
Reviews.Author: TS68
Reviews.Content: Just started to read the last review and then got entirely bored....blah...blah...blah. Anyway, what you need to know about this hotel is.... 1) Its centrally located, near the terminal but not so near as to be in a nasty area (as some are). Its situated opposite the opera house and near by to Republica metro station. Everything of note is walkable from this hotel with the possible exception of the Vatican. 2) The rooms are small - and i mean small. Looks like appartments that have been split into small hotel rooms. They are contemporary in style, very nicely done, air conditioned, clean, but would maybe be too small for a lengthy stay (we only had 3 days so was fine) 3) The reception staff were friendly enough to us, breakfast was good (standard continental style), free interenet available in reception and rooms were cleaned daily (fresh towels etc). 4) I understand there is an annex building. I cannot comment on this. We requested and stayed in the main building and had a fouth floor room with a nice view over the opera house. Noisy with the windows open, but if shutters and windows are closed you can hear nothing at all. All in all, a good central hotel at a reasonable price. Enjoy Rome - its beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “"Excellent Value"”
Reviews.Author: Troonster
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after poring over Tripadvisor reviews looking at $200-and-under lodging. Our previous favorite, the San Carlo in Centro Storico has gone to almost $300/night. This 3-night stay followed a week on a cramped sailboat, so a comfortable and quiet room were priorities I agree with other reviewers: a very good location, ten minute's walk from the Termini and 20 minutes to the Spanish Steps. The hotel lobby is on the ground floor of a large building that also houses apartments. Our room was inside, on the fourth floor, accessible by steps or an open elevator. The room had a large window opening onto a central area. The room was good-sized and had an armoire, desk with clothing storage, bath with bidet and small shower, all impeccably clean. Excellent a/c. Extra pillows are stocked in the armoire. The towels were ample but a little rough, a minor complaint. Breakfast was basic: cereals, breads and jams, packaged cheese , rather unripe fruit. and yogurt. The juice and coffee were not up to par although on the morning we departed very early we were presented with two cups of perfect espresso! Hotel staff were friendly and went out of their way to be helpful. The free internet access is a plus. Our rate was 140 Euros per night, good value with today's weak dollar. We'll return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ElvDvd
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel and was very statisfied with everything! The location is perfect! The hotel is run by one family, all of which work at the either the front desk or the breakfast. The breakfast coffee was one of the best in Rome and the hotel room was extremely clean. We were in their new location down the street from the reception desk, but not inconvenient at all. When asked for some information on how to reach to the soccer stadium they pointed us in the right direction and helped us find the less expensive way to get there. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: gravity1000
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this practical little hotel. Its location is ideal - basically all the stuff/sites of Rome are in a circle around and near the hotel. I walked everywhere, though for less active people, it would be a cheap (for Rome) taxi fare to most popular places. In addition, its an easy, and safe, walk from the Termini station, which is very convenient if arriving by air. The hotel itself is very matter-of-fact looking - in fact, like so many Roman buildings, the hotel shares floors with other businesses and apartments. Its actually very interesting to see this mixture, when, all over the world I have usually seen hotels in their own exclusive buildings. This was never a problem though, since I heard very little of anyone else in the 10 days I stayed there. My room was tiny - be prepared for this - and faced out over the opera building (the front of the building, where you enter. Perhaps they have other larger rooms - I don't know. However, it was very nicely done in marble and had a TV with CNN in English. There were no other English channels - something the management should look at improving, I think, given its popularity on Tripadvisor. The room was spotlessly cleaned every day. My only other suggestion with the room, is make sure you have a electric outlet adaptor (or 2, if you have more than one device!). Since the adaptor point is Italian system. The staff could not have been more helpful. I appreciated the fact that when I came down for breakfast, I was offered TWO cappucinos/coffe with milk/juices etc. Breakfast wasn't skimped at all. It was not varied however, in any way, and consisted of rolls, cake, hard boiled eggst, fruit, cereal, and croissants. They will heat anything you ask them to, and do it cheerfully. It is the epitomy of what is known as a "Continental Breakfast". The front desk was accomodative to me, and when I gave them advance warning that I needed to reduce my stay by 5 days, gave me no problems at all. They provide city maps for you, and will explain how to get to places as well. Most important for me, they have an excellent free wireless signal for a laptop, in the rooms (certainly in mine, though I cant speak for the other rooms. I was on the 5th floor). If you dont have a laptop, they have 2 computers in the front desk area for you to use, free of charge. In summary, I rated it excellent because it was exactly what I wanted - a clean, cheap, decent room in a good location, somewhere to crash at night and do everything else outside the hotel, with a decent breakfast, helpful staff, and a strong free wireless Internet connection. My suggestion would be that if something is important to you, email the hotel before-hand and let them know what you are sensitive to, and I am sure you will be accomodated. I did this (I did not want to be in the Annexe). Enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: BoBarz
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 booked 2 double rooms at this hotel based on Rick Steve's and one of the forum's reviewer's tip. We asked rooms on the fifth floor and were given 2 rooms on the fifth floor (540 and 541). The rooms had ample space for two, sparse but clean. The rooms are not really sound-proofed as my spouse and I can hear loud noises coming from our kid's room.The bathrooms were also kept clean, and towels and toiletries replenished daily. Staff were very helpful and fortunately had a good grasp of English. Breakfast is included , and had cakes, croissants, danish, rolls, juice, boiled eggs, yogurt, cheese, and butter. I have to point out that their cappuccino is better than what the cruise line we just sailed with had to offer. We stayed for three nights and would gladly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a very good experience”
Reviews.Author: skwood
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Annex of the Hotel Sonya and found it to be clean, quiet, and quite comfortable; the ongoing construction presented no problems. I was a single staying in a double room, so found the size of the room to be more than adequate. The location is excellent; even though the train station is only a 5-7 minute walk the street itself in quiet and the location is great since it is close to 2 Metro stations. I see that some people found the staff to be impersonal but I thought everyone I interacted with was pleasant and helpful. I would definitely return to the hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal!”
Reviews.Author: fromflorida7
Reviews.Content: Location and tripadvisor reviews sold us on this hotel! The rate was a great deal considering all that was included, like breakfast and free internet. Room was a little tight (we crammed in our four family members) but very clean and so quiet (I think they had sound-proof windows!). Also, there was a nifty electric drying rack in the bathroom great for washing out undies! Location was very good -- pretty close to Termini, where you can get on the metro or take a train. Good eateries and shopping nearby. Front desk was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly very good”
Reviews.Author: Canadian67
Reviews.Content: As has been experienced by others we were placed in the Annex around the corner. As this Annex is still undergoing construction there was some noise but not enough to keep us up or to become annoying. While some outside doors were left open during construction there was adequate electronic card security in accessing the hotel area on the second floor and our room. The room was newly renovated and attractive and in excellent condition. It was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was of good size and contained excellent facilities. They also made available a clothes line in the bathroom for when we did some light laundry. The breakfast was excellent as was the service but the breakfast room itself was not particularly attractive and very noisy. The staff was not particularly helpful -- one time I stood before the receptionist for a few minutes without being acknowledged. However there was one employee, Farad Ahmed, who was extremely personable and helpful at all times. I never saw the owner even though he was around and he never walked around to see how things were going. The location is excellent and after the construction is completed the Annex promises to be a pleasant and beautiful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean, and good breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: VacationEngineer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Sonya for 3 nights last month. They had everything we needed to be comfortable. It is very convenient; we walked to the coliseum, the train station, and Trevi fountain and the Spanish steps. The breakfast was good - we had fruit, yogurt, pastries, and the best hot chocolate. They even put a smile face on the top of the chocolate for the kids! The staff was very friendly, calling taxis for us and answering our every question. Everyone seemed to speak fairly good English. We had free Internet access from several computers in the lobby. Our room was on the 3rd floor but there is an elevator. In our room, we had 2 twin beds and a king bed for our family of 4. The bathroom had a shower and a bidet. The window opened; there are shutters and curtains but no screens (which seemed to be the norm in Italy). There was a TV, an armoir, a desk, and an end table. When we return to Rome, we'll definitely consider Hotel Sonya again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Find”
Reviews.Author: GabalishCA
Reviews.Content: I was extremely impressed with Hotel Sonya. We stayed there 3 nights in October of 2006. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. They provided complementary internet access on two computers located in there front lobby. Breakfast was included with the room price. They provided a great assortment of fruit, crackers, croissants and of course a delicious cappuccino. Our room was located on the fourth floor and you had the option of taking the stairs or an old cage looking elevator. Hotel Sonya is located across the street from the Opera house and about 3-4 blocks from the train station (walking distance). I would recommend this place or stay in it again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Fil1423
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Sonya for five nights in March of 2007. It was really nice and affordable too. I just graduated from college and wanted to travel abroad before I started looking for a job and we decided on Rome. Hotel Sonya was recommended in the Rick Steves book that I got from the library. I was pleased by the service and the room. Nothing really fancy, but comfortable. There is a grocery store right across the street. We walked to everything and hotel Sonya is really close to just about everything, including the bus terminal and some of the Tour services. We used Green Line tours to visit Pompeii and Florence and it was only a couple blocks away for hotel Sonya. There is a little pizza place around the corner that sells pizza by the slice and we ended up stopping there just about every night on our way back to the hotel. I would stay in this hotel again if I ever get a chance to visit Rome again!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sonya was perfect”
Reviews.Author: QuigsCalif
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights in Hotel Sonya. We were put in one of the rooms down the street. Like previous reviews, the room was small but newly remodeled. VERY clean and modern. Breakfast here was one of the best we had during our Italy travel. We took the Metro instead of taxi's which worked out great. Did tons of walking. Rome is fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Sonya”
Reviews.Author: mpartyp
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sonya is a great hotel. The staff is extremely kind, the location is good (near the train) and the breakfasts are great. The rooms are quite small (but you are only there to sleep - so no worries). The price is good for Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Housing”
Reviews.Author: PAPhillyTraveler
Reviews.Content: Basic housing in a convenient location. For a US traveler, the initial impression of the area/hotel might seem a bit dicey. The elevators are the old open cage style. After registration we were surprised to be led a block away to another building to our room. But upon arrival in the room area everything was just fine. As with most european rooms it was a bit small. The shower was tight for a full grown man but serviceable. They were renovating the entire room area while we were there. Workers putting up new drywall and carpeting. So everything was fresh and clean. Security seems fine - 3 magnetic locked doors between you and the street. The bathroom was marble with steel fixtures, towel warmer. The morning breakfast service is fine with a couple very nice waiters keeping things filled and cleaned. Basic continental breakfast. Don't expect room service and the front desk does not answer the phone at night. The staff was helpful. And it was a nice surprise to find a few internet connected laptops available in the lobby. For the price this is a good value. Save your money by staying here for your taxi rides. Even though it is near the local attractions, you will find yourself taking taxis quite often. Their website is a bit deceptive. The picture you see is NOT the hotel. That is the Opera house which is nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sonya was terrific”
Reviews.Author: cindyloowhoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the annex and were very delighted with the entire experience, after our initial shock. When we arrived and were being taken to the annex, we were sure that the place was going to be a dump. The workers were installing a new floor at the entrance, and our room number was written on a piece of masking tape. We were so pleasantly suprised when we entered a brand new room, we know our faces must have lit up. We had read that the service was a little cold, but that was not the case. Everyone was very friendly and helpful, and knew the minute we walked in for breakfast that we wanted capuccino. The breakfast consisted of a variety of items in the main hotel. And the location of the Sonya was convenient to the subway and the Termini. Excellent Value.

Reviews.Title: “Good Central Option”
Reviews.Author: badwaiter
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Sonya was an excellent option in the center of Rome. It's very close to the train station and we walked from the hotel to the colosseum and the pantheon, though the latter is a bit of a hike. We stayed in the new annex. On first arrival it's a bit sketchy. The building is being rehabbed and there's nothing about it to let you know that you are walking into a hotel from the outside. However, once inside the room was super new, super modern, and super clean. The breakfast is sufficient and the staff are helpful. The free internet in the main location is a plus. I have no idea what the rooms in the main building look like but I think if you request a room in the new annex you can't go wrong. I was very happy with the bed. It was new and firm. If you are hitting Rome on a budget and want a nice central hotel with cold AC, this is for you.

Reviews.Title: “tiny annex rooms”
Reviews.Author: Hobiz2
Reviews.Content: we too were put in the 'annex' which didn't have a secure front door, and the door to the specific floor didn't lock. We felt vulnerable the entire night. Also it is in an apartment building with terrible walls and a vent system that allowed us to hear voices all night long. the rooms were very small. Maybe the main hotel is better?? The front desk was helpful. It is less than a 5min walk to the train station.

Reviews.Title: “A great option for sightseers in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: DolceVita79
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel in a Rick Steves tour book, and it is an excellent choice for a busy stay in Rome. The rooms are spotless, and ours was quiet. The staff is fluent in English and very helpful, and the Termini train station is only about 10 minutes away by sidewalks, in a safe neighborhood. Our room (for five people) had plenty of linens and a small TV, and the prices are extremely competitive for Rome.

Reviews.Title: “New Annex Part of Sonya is Modern & Stylish”
Reviews.Author: starbuck212
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Sonya in Oct 2006 as part of a Rick Steves tour group. We were fortunate enough to be the very first people to stay in the new part of the Hotel Sonya which is across the street from the original hotel (same side of street as the Opera -- you can hear them rehearsing through your window in the afternoons, it is lovely!). They refer to this newer part of the hotel as the "Annex". Even though the hallways & such were unfinished when we were there, the rooms were really really nice!!! Very modern w/ flat screen tvs, marble bath, etc. I have no idea if it is more $ than the original Sonya, again, we lucked out because we were on a tour & even the tour guide didn't know they would be putting us in this Annex hotel. Our breakfast was back at the regular Sonya - very nice continental breakfast w/ chocolate croissants & other treats. The cappucino was served w/ a heart shape in the foam. really cute! Great location for the hotel, Rome is a wonderful city!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in downtown Rome”
Reviews.Author: mntravelers4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Sonya for three nights in August 2006, and had a wonderful stay at a very reasonable price! The hotel was spotlesslly clean, and our quad room was very spacious, accommodating two adults and two teens more than adequately. We walked to the Forum/Colosseum area from the hotel three of the four days we were there, a hilly trek but certainly do-able. The main bus route (infamous bus #64, which takes you out to St. Peter's/Vatican and many sights enroute) stop was only a block and a half away. The Opera house is literally across the street, if you were to stay during the season (we did not). There is a great basement grocery store just across the street and an ATM a half a block down the street. The front desk staff members were extremely helpful and were friendly. The breakfast was wonderful; buffet style, with very attentive waiters to help once we were seated. The small lobby had two computers with free internet access, definitely a plus for our teenagers! We had an interesting thing happen at the Sonya, though...after spending the day at the Forum area, we came back to find that we had a different bathroom sink (with vanity cabinet) than the one in place when we left that morning (no vanity)! No one told us they were going to be doing that, so it was a little disconcerting to us, wondering at first if we were seeing things, or just hadn't paid attention to the sink before then! If we ever have the good fortune to return to Rome, this would be our first choice to stay at again!

Reviews.Title: “free internet! :)”
Reviews.Author: buzibody
Reviews.Content: Only 10 to 15 minutes walk from termini train station. Near to 2 metro stations, one being the main one (termini) and the other is Republica. Opposite the Opera theatre. There are also many small cafes and a supermarket in the vincinity. Friendly and efficient reception, sometimes the welcoming party includes a husky dog. Breakfast at the hotel is sufficient. There is also computer terminals for free internet. Comfy beds and many blankets and pillows. The bathroom is great!

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: marmite81
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Sonya with my mum as a long weekend trip from 02 Nov to 05 Nov. We loved it!!! Initially didn't know what to expect as we had stayed on the main Nationale street 3 year previous but this was perfect.!!! Great location, literally just one street behind the main street, quiet, imaculate, comfortable and very friendly. We arrived late and checked out late, all of which were not a problem. The room itself is not the biggest i have ever stayed in yet, there was plenty of room for two women to comfortably fit. The bathroom was lovely, all marble with fresh towels every day. Yet again maybe a little bit small but still fine for what we were looking for. Breakfast was great too......Continental, as you will find in most European hotels but all fresh fruit, bread, croissant, cakes and cereal. Really can not fault it. I would definitely stay again :o)

Reviews.Title: “Great Dollar Value”
Reviews.Author: FrauReisende
Reviews.Content: A great value. Clean, comfortable and convenient. Hotel staff were very obliging. If you want luxury, go elsewhere. If you want comfortable basic accommodation, you won't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Very Small Clean hotel, with OK facilites in a good location..”
Reviews.Author: Sauv
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from 4 nights at the Sonya from Oct 12-16. First impressions of hotel were bad as you walk into the building to find the reception at the back of the 'dodgy' lift/elavator. The hotel is very small, the recption is small, the breakfast room is very small, maybe fits 15 people max. Breakfast was ok, but you must arrive early to get best food (7am-10am Breakfast) try arrive before 9am . Now, the rooms are very clean and bathrooms were very clean, spotless in fact. We didnt have a bath, just a shower and the shower is ok but again, very small.... Our party had 5 rooms in total(4 in this hotel and one is the sister hotel/apartment complex across the road). room across the road was in a private apartment complex but was fited out with Flat Screen TV and marble bathroms with a jazuzzi bath, nice touch but a walk of about 2mins to main building where reception/ breakfast room was. Overall, I would stay in this hotel again as its very clean, good location and friendly although quiet staff. We paid 125 Per Room Per night which is good value but a 4* in same area would not cost a huge amount more. if your looking for a clean , central hotel that is of OK standard then book this hotel. Once bad thing about hotel...Its very noisy!...One rooms toilet must be next to one rooms headboard, as all we heard all night was the flushing of a toilet.... all our rooms were pretty noisy although not all had the same toilet problem..Corridoors are noisy aswell, you can litterlay hear everything, even for me who is a deep sleeper. Rome is great though and you will be so tired after walking around the sites, that you may not notice the noise, (Although i doubt it) Good restaurants and Irish Bars within 5mins walk.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and convenient place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: CrazyHiker
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Sonya from 8/26-8/29. We arrived from the US in the morning and they had a room ready for us to crash in when we arrived at 9:30AM (which was nice and unexpected). The front desk staff was always really nice and friendly. The room and bathroom were always very clean, and the room size was typical of a standard double in three star hotels in large European cities. Breakfast was included in the cost of the room and was one of the best European breakfasts we had from the 8 hotels in 24 days we spent in Italy and Switzerland. When we checked out one of the receipts showed the amount in US dollars and an exchange rate that was very unfavorable (1.31 USD to EUR). The market rate on the net was 1.27 at the time. This was similar to what others have described in TripAdvisor reviews of Hotel Caravaggio in Florence. Nevertheless, my credit card was charged at a rate of 1.29 which also included the unfortunate 1% foreign transaction fee my card charges. We would definitely choose to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: honeybee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Sonya for 3 nights in August 2006, during a 2 week trip to Italy. The room was large and the bathroom a good size, and both exceptionally clean. Having a map to find the hotel from the train station would have helped the first night as the most direct route is only about a 7 minutes walk. The Colloseum was only a 10 min walk away, and the Trevi Fountain was also only about 10-15 min walk away in the other direction. Breakfast was very good, with hard boiled eggs, ham, cheese, yogurts, fruit, cereal, juice and coffee, certainly a good start to the day. There are 2 computers in the reception room for internet use at no charge. There is a short flight of stairs from the street up to the reception room and a lift up to the rooms. There is a street market around the corner selling very reasonable clothing, shoes, fruits etc. August is off season in Rome and the 70 Euro rate/night was the best deal of all the Italian hotels I stayed in. Book direct with the hotel. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. Staff extremely friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless, Friendly, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Bobgeri
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for nine nights while in Rome. The hotel was spotless and the breakfast was good. The room was quite nice and very comfortable at a very reasonable price. We paid off season rates of 70eu per night for a double room. The lobby had three computers so we could check our email easily .The hotel was a short walk from the train station and bus stops and easy walking distance from many sites. What made this hotel most special was the helpful, friendy staff. This was a nice hotel for families and couples alike. We were able to stay in a non-smoking room. The room was easy to book online and the hotel answered emailed questions quite quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: PNFranks
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a two and a half week trip through Italy. We spent four days in Rome at Hotel Sonya. We are very picky when it comes to hotels. We usually stay at Hiltons, Marriotts, etc. in the U.S. but seeing as how we were on a budget we opted for this hotel. The room was clean, as well as the bathroom. The bathroom was a little cramped but we found that it depended which room you were in. Some rooms are small with larger bathrooms and vice versa. The staff was very nice and the breakfast was good. We have no complaints about this place. It's in a perfect location near the train station and the neighborhood is not sketchy at all. We would definitely recommend this hotel if you were stopping through Rome, even if you are skeptical of 3 star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: tazi1221
Reviews.Content: While we were in Rome we stayed at the Hotel Sonya. It is a nice enough hotel, with basic amenities. The hotel was clean, though some parts of the room looked a little worn, and had a good location just a few minutes from the train station. This was convenient as we were able to walk to the hotel with our bags and not have to worry about getting a cab.The bed was firm and the hotel staff was very friendly. The clerk at the front desk even took us up to our room and carried my bag for me! The air conditioning in this hotel worked the best out of every hotel we stayed in while traveling in Italy. The breakfast was simple, but fine for our purposes as we are not big breakfast eaters. It consisted mostly of rolls, fruit, a couple cereals, and yogurt. While the hotel is not next to many of the big attractions in Rome, it was very easy to get anywhere. There is a metro station just a couple of blocks away, and Rome's subway is very clean. We actually walked most everywhere, and it was not too far. There are a couple of good restaurants near the hotel, including Ristorante del Giglio. One piece of advice would be to avoid eating in very touristy areas. The food was not as good as when we ate a couple of blocks away! Overall, the Hotel Sonya was a good hotel, but I might try another place in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, good value for Rome”
Reviews.Author: amiller16
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with our stay at Sonya - helpful, friendly staff, convenient location minutes away from the train station, nice breakfast and clean room with a view. It's a good value for Rome, especially if you're just looking for a decent place to sleep while on the go as we were. They even have free email!

Reviews.Title: “Decent, central hotel”
Reviews.Author: oregongirl2005
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel as part of a tour group in May 2006. Very helpful hotel staff - when I needed to change rooms at the end of my tour (extended my stay by one night), they figured out a way I could stay in the first room and not move. The location is very convenient, 3 blocks to Termini metro/train station, about the same to Republica metro as well. Relatively quiet for a city hotel. The neighborhood not too bad considering it’s near the train station. The hotel shares space with other tenants (business and private), so it’s quite a walk up stairs (or a somewhat scary elevator) to the rooms. Note - they use electronic key cards, which you must leave in a slot next to the entry door to turn on the lights (the desk staff was very nice about my frantic call about inoperable light switches, they’re probably used to it). Decent breakfast, good coffee, but the breakfast room is tiny. Free internet access at three terminals during the day. There is a supermarket across the street, convenient for quick snacks. There is a mini bar fridge in the room, but it didn’t actually appear to be cold, so don’t count on it for food storage. They advertise an airport shuttle, but I saw at least two people who ended up calling a taxi because the shuttle was a no-show (or extremely late). It is easy to catch the 9 euro shuttle train from Termini to Da Vinci airport, but it is quite a hike to the train platform, so don’t bother if you have a lot of luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, smaller hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmelong
Reviews.Content: Nice, very clean, comfortable and quiet hotel situated near Metro and Termini stations. Located on a relatively quiet street in a safe area. Several Restaurants nearby for dining after a long day of sightseeing. The very helpful staff was indeed a high point in our stay here, and assisted in answering unending questions and providing excellant service. I found this hotel in Rick Steves book and it lived up to all my expectations. Rick noted that staff was "somewhat impersonnal" but I instead found them quite helpful. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here on my next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for budget travellers”
Reviews.Author: Sonicdbd
Reviews.Content: Great location for seeing Rome and being near the Metro. Room was good with good bath. Walls pretty thin, we had very noisy teenage neighbors that quieted down after very late night talk! However, the service at the hotel was wonderful. Metro and bus strike on the last day we were there, but the person at the front desk informed us about it and finally, after 45 mins. got thru to a taxi so we would not be late for our museum reservation. Breakfast was typical for Italy, but the service for coffee and tea was very quick. As in a previous review on this forum, there was a hot water heater for tea or coffee in the room, but no packets of either.... so if you want this, bring your own. Plenty of good places to eat nearby as well. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved Our Stay At The Hotel Sonya”
Reviews.Author: vikingstwinsman
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I had a great experience at the Hotel Sonya. Our stay was from April 1 to April 8, 2006. The location was perfect for either walking in Rome or hopping a bus to travel throughout Rome. We enjoyed the Farmers/Vendors Market each morning from 7 AM - 1 PM around the corner. The gelato shop, liquor store, and phone calling shop (Teatro dell' Opera) all within a block were all great places. We got to know each of the owners during our stay and they became friends we looked forward to seeing every day. The phone shop (Teatro dell' Opera across the street) offered super deals on long distance calls back to the states for 10 cents per minute; we had been paying $1.00 per minute before we found them. Another plus was having access super market across the street, with good deals. Back to the Hotel Sonya…. The staff and owners were very friendly, we enjoyed the daily breakfast of rolls, fruit, cappuccino and juice. The room was small, functional and very clean and included a shower stall. The wireless internet was a real plus because I could use my laptop in my room. The hotel also offered 3 computers for their guests to use in the lobby. Finally, the price was very fair and the shuttle service was only 12 euro per person to and from the airport, my brother and his son stayed in a nearby hotel and took a taxi for 48 euro. I would definitely stay at the Hotel Sonya in a heartbeat on any future trips to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely time in Rome, thanks to the location of the hotel. We could walk everywhere. The hotel in itself was wonderful, clean, the staff quite helpful. Stay here it is great.

Reviews.Title: “I have nothing to complain about!”
Reviews.Author: mrsmuppet
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from my stay at the Hotel Sonya and found the hotel absolutely fine. The previous review mentions that they thought the "Opera House" was a picture of the hotel but if you read the previous reviews and look at other travellers pictures - it clearly says a picture of the view from our room! As for rubbish I saw no flies or rubbish outside the hotel. I found the hotel staff very helpful and attentive. With regards to the rooms I can see that there has been previous issues so I will state that we stayed in a room on the 1st floor. Our view was of a side street which was fine as it was quieter than being on the front. The room was quite big - in fact bigger than some 4 star hotels I've stayed at. The bathroom was also fine and my 6ft 4 husband had no problem using the shower. The most important thing to me was that it was clean, the bathroom was spotless. The curtains and bedding were a little tired but again its no different to many 4 star hotels, and this hotel was very reasonably priced in a superb location. Minutes walk from the metro, bus station and main train terminal. There are ample restuarants and bars around the area and you can also walk to many of the sights from here. Breakfast is continental style, with fresh crossiants and cake! Yum! Yes the room is small but its a family run hotel and we found it fine, plus there is a picture of it on the hotel website and its no different. The hotel lobby/reception has two computers in it, where you can access the internet for free. We found this very useful for planning our days out and keeping in touch with home. Check out is at 11am but the hotel staff were happy to look after our luggage so we could maximise our time in room before our flight left. I would recommend this hotel to a friend as it was reasonably priced, clean and in a good location. One thing I think could be improved is that whilst the room is equipped with a kettle there were no tea, coffee, sugar or milk sachets so if you are staying I'm sure you can pick some up on the way! Arrivederci!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel picture is the Opera House!”
Reviews.Author: lilsy
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were very disappointed when the taxi pulled up in front of the hotel- the photos we had seen of the hotel on the Internet were of the opera house across the road, the hotel was above the shops opposite! The entrance had two large rubbish bins on the roadside and you had to 'wave' the flies out of the way as you walked through the doors. On arrival when we said to the receptionist that the hotel didnt look anything like the pictures we had seen, he said 'but what are you going to do, you have already paid for your rooms! We didnt leave as it was late at night and we were only there a few nights, so we put up with it. The room was the smallest I have ever stayed and the bathroom was like one you would expect to see in a caravan. The breakfast was poor, in a cramped room with orange squash and not fresh juice. The only good thing, it was close to the station but we would certainly not recommend this hotel as there are plenty of others to choose.

Reviews.Title: “Simply average”
Reviews.Author: ditravels1629
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night last month based on all the positive reviews but was totally underwhelmed by the hotel. The room although small was perfectly adequate and very clean but it was directly across from the elevator and the hall door and was very noisy. The TV received only one fuzzy channel. The breakfast selction and quality was below that of other Italian hotels in the same class and the staff was rude. While the hotel's proximity to the train station is supposed to be a major selling point, it's a good 5 block walk and I think it would be difficult if you had more than a small suitcase. The surrounding neighborhood is filled with restaurants that cater solely to tourists and so the food is mediocre compared to the rest of Rome and the whole area lacks any sense of atmosphere which is so prevalent in the rest of the city. That said, one big positive aspect of the hotel is the shuttle service to the airport. The hotel booked me a a direct shuttle to Fiumicino for only 12 euros. It was very comfortable and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jonno_the_Yachtie
Reviews.Content: About 10-15 minutes walk from Termini station, this great little budget hotel was ideal for us (2 adults & 2 teens). Good-sized comfortable rooms (we were on the 5th floor and it all seemed quite recently refurbished), decent breakfast and friendly staff. Its also not noisy which was a big plus. We went at the end of December and the rates were good - we paid half what many similar looking hotels were charging. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “BASIC HOTEL BUT CLOSE TO ALL ATTRACTIONS”
Reviews.Author: pandj17
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights and found the staff very helpful and friendly. The rooms were an average size with plain decor but warm ours faced onto the opera house. The breakfast area was slightly disappointing cramped with not much choice and there was no hotel resturant.The hotel is approx 10 minute walk from the train station and approx 5 minute walk to the nearest metro/subway which is extremely handy. There are plenty of resturants in the immediate area including the famous est est est which we dined at and the food was surperb, and there is a lively irish bar just around the corner open until late. If its a walk to the main attractions you are after both the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps are approx 20 minutes away and the Collusum approx 30 minutes away.All in all you don't spend much time in your hotel room whilst in Rome so I found Hotel Sonya an ideal, affordable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at the Sonya”
Reviews.Author: Jakerson
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sonya for 4 nights at the end of November, 2005. Had a wonderful experience there. When I travel by myself and request a single room, it can sometimes produce little more than a broom closet with a cot stuck in it but my room at the Sonya was spacious and looked out on the Opera House across the street. The heated towel rack was a nice plus and I loved the 1930's style cage elevator. Was the hot water a little dodgy (have had the same thing happens at "5 star" hotels), the shower stall a bit small and the "orange juice" at breakfast from another planet. Yes. SO WHAT! Overall, a great hotel, really nice, clean rooms, decent continental spread at breakfast, helpful front desk staff, free use of internet terminal in the lobby and a terrific location, all for a great price. If I visit Rome again, without question, this is where I will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: With a group of nine I stayed three nights in this hotel. Five minutes walkingdistance from termini station. Nice helpful personnel, clean and neat rooms with comfortable beds and good showers. 24 hours open with nightportier. Nice breakfast with eggs, orange juice and cappocino. Free internet acces. Good price/quality.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel. Good location.”
Reviews.Author: jaee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sonya from Oct 13-16. We had scheduled an airport pickup with them for only 12 euro each which was great considering people spend 40 euro to take a taxi. The staff is friendly and very accomodating. The breakfast is really good, a good assortment of breads and bunt cakes and cereal. The freshly squeezed orange juice makes Tropicana look like swamp water. They have 24 hour internet acess in the lobby which is free, a nice little bonus. the rooms were clean and room service was excellent. the shower is a little small, our room had no tub but a standing shower which a man over 6 feet might not be comfortable in. Overall the location was perfect coz its close to the bus terminal and we could take buses everywhere. It is safe at night too. They even let us leave our bags at the hotel after we checked out in the morning since our train to Florence wasnt till 5pm. I would reccommend this hotel to anyone/couples on a budget. Our room cost us 130 euro per night.

Reviews.Title: “What's not to like?”
Reviews.Author: deadlaw
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel in an apartment building a short walk from the Termini. The location could not be better. It is about 100m from the Metro. The room was spacious and clean. There is free internet. The elevator is straight out of the Maltese Falcon. The staff is pleasant and helpful. The breakfast may seem small if you like the Denny's Grand Slam, but if that is the case, maybe you should not be travelling out of the USA. They serve rolls, yogurt, boiled eggs, and cappucino or black coffee. [Stay away from the juice. It might be the actual Tang that went into space--it's hard to tell.] There is a place down the street that serves some of the best pizza on the planet for 8 Euro [take that, Lombardi's and Sal's!]. The neighborhood is good as well. There is no surcharge for using the phone with your phonecard. Get the phonecard from across the street at the Internet shop. A 5 Euro card will get you 200 minutes.
